commit_message:
Removes the use of mutables as default args

Passing mutable objects as default args is a known Python pitfall.
We'd better avoid this. This commit changes mutable default args with
None, 'arg = [] if arg is None else arg'.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I2909b111266c696bcdcd26db167d3ad5e0603e45

commit_message:
Integration tests cleanup

This patch does a cleanup and fixes some nits found by reviewers
in the original patches [1], some of them are:

- import json instead of jsonutils
- use six.moves.http_client
- put common logic on clients superclass
- use "fails" to indicate negative cases
- stronger comparison in update tests

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:federation_integration_tests

Change-Id: I216fc5d4758e7b09d167d9d26271ddd149c66816

Before this patch only local inheritance information was stored in the
'inherits' field in glare. This means, that requesting all the
packages, that inherit from class X would only yield immediate
relatives, rather than all.

Closes-Bug: #1585419

commit_message:
Store transitive inheritance information in glare

Before this patch only local inheritance information was stored in the
'inherits' field in glare. This means, that requesting all the
packages, that inherit from class X would only yield immediate
relatives, rather than all.
This patch adds transitive inheritance information to the same field.

Change-Id: I5096a2dd105dd70ff42b35eebbd850a9b66c9274
Closes-Bug: #1585419

In a cloud with multi-tenancy, administrators
would like to see the project_id of the tenant
while listing snapshots of all tenants.

Likewise, we also should expose the user_id field
as it would help in cases where tenants have multiple
users.

DocImpact
User and administrator references need to capture

Change-Id: I3ad655dc9ab7440f205b0e153fccaa99abb79bbd
Closes-Bug: #1587161

commit_message:
Add user_id and project_id to snapshot APIs

In a cloud with multi-tenancy, administrators
would like to see the project_id of the tenant
while listing snapshots of all tenants.

Likewise, we also should expose the user_id field
as it would help in cases where tenants have multiple
users.

DocImpact
User and administrator references need to capture
this information.

APIImpact
API changes are micro-versioned.

Change-Id: I3ad655dc9ab7440f205b0e153fccaa99abb79bbd
Closes-Bug: #1587161

commit_message:
Implement meta-classes for UI hints

The following meta-classes are implemented and placed to the core
library: Title, Description, HelpText, Hidden, Section, Position.
They can be attached to the different MuranoPL entities and used
during the automatic UI definition generation.
Also meta-class ModelBuilder is added for marking special static
methods.

Change-Id: I474d69b2cadb9b200e70d4d9daaef3e87d9cb3a5
Partially-implements: blueprint muranopl-forms

Previously user_domain_id and project_domain_id was hardcoded to
"default" which causes an error in environments using PostgreSQL or
case-sensirive MySQL as DB backend.

Change-Id: Id8489ad712deebff2248fbf404df255f484a8071

(cherry picked from commit cae7e61787745b361268b7297d57e13b3a2061dc)

commit_message:
Updated *_domain_id to "Default"

Previously user_domain_id and project_domain_id was hardcoded to
"default" which causes an error in environments using PostgreSQL or
case-sensirive MySQL as DB backend.

Change-Id: Id8489ad712deebff2248fbf404df255f484a8071
Closes-Bug: #1580611
(cherry picked from commit cae7e61787745b361268b7297d57e13b3a2061dc)

commit_message:
Initialize neutron client with region name

All clients except neutron are initialized with region name.
This makes unable to use network related commands of
openstackclient in multi-region configurations

Closes-bug: 1570491
(cherry picked from commit 8c6b5a087a4b0dca16faffdbcb5fc9f2d424ddf8)

Conflicts:
	openstackclient/network/client.py
Change-Id: I200dc9a2f938c3e69357f91c79810df167e4fccb

subject: plan: allow plan with empty dict parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-19 06:27:57.000000000', 'files': ['smaug/api/v1/plans.py', 'smaug/tests/unit/api/v1/test_plans.py'], 'message': 'plan: allow plan with empty dict parameters

Validation on parameters counted on the condition:
  "parameters is None"
which is also True when parameters is an empty dict.
This patch fixes that and allows an empty dict as plan parameters

Change-Id: I10ea8dd19ce443ca717903e1e5faf34309d30ecf
'}]
commit_message:
plan: allow plan with empty dict parameters

Validation on parameters counted on the condition:
  "parameters is None"
which is also True when parameters is an empty dict.
This patch fixes that and allows an empty dict as plan parameters

Change-Id: I10ea8dd19ce443ca717903e1e5faf34309d30ecf

commit_message:
Update oslo.cache to 1.9.0

* Updated from global requirements
* Add reno for releasenotes management
* Trivial: ignore openstack/common in flake8 exclude list
* Imported Translations from Zanata
* Remove direct dependency on babel
* Updated from global requirements
* If caching is globally disabled force dogpile to use the null backend

Change-Id: I883f9c2014887dd7f3681d2beafe6d9517958090

subject: Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-18 16:53:08.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-prep.yml', 'test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Stable branches
should have requirements pinned anyway.

This patch pins to the current stable/mitaka requirements from
the OpenStack requirements repository.

Additionally, remove the running of openstack_hosts against localhost
during testing to unblock the gate.

Change-Id: I5a57585fabb6e1bbbc1817681ccd9eb5e4845664
'}]
commit_message:
Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Stable branches
should have requirements pinned anyway.

This patch pins to the current stable/mitaka requirements from
the OpenStack requirements repository.

Additionally, remove the running of openstack_hosts against localhost
during testing to unblock the gate.

Change-Id: I5a57585fabb6e1bbbc1817681ccd9eb5e4845664

commit_message:
Change chef installation method

Fedora and Centos don't have chef in their repos.
So we need to install it in another way.
This patch adds an ability to install chef in different ways
depending on a used distro (ubuntu, fedora, centos7)

Change-Id: I1a8ea048791cc0498e78c6a406ef9b486d213471
Related-Bug: #1578991

commit_message:
Port test_agent and test_catalog to Python 3

* Replace str.encode('base64') with
  oslo_serialization.base64.encode_as_text()+'\n'
* tox.ini: run test_agent.py and test_catalog.py unit test
  on Python 3.4

Blueprint: murano-python-3-support
Change-Id: Ibe44c2450779651c9b01d99411e30980459b32eb

commit_message:
Add support for Zaqar websocket messaging

Updates the plugin ClientManager so that we support creating
a websocket authenticated with Zaqar so that actions can
interact with Zaqar queues.

Co-Authored-By: Thomas Herve <therve@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dougal Matthews <dougal@redhat.com>

Depends on external: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/1289
Partially-implements: blueprint remote-execution
Change-Id: Idf522b3d4193776a5b6626cef28336820257d4e7

subject: Correct concurrency of gabbi tests for gabbi 1.22.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-20 03:00:58.000000000', 'files': ['.testr.conf'], 'message': 'Correct concurrency of gabbi tests for gabbi 1.22.0

When running gabbi under testr, concurrency grouping is controlled
by a regex in .testr.conf. A module name change in gabbi 1.22.0
inadvertently broke the grouping. This change should work for
old and new versions.

Change-Id: I9c875d8c73ccdfe633279914259061a8c3a7bf3d
(cherry picked from commit 86e94d9ab2b46080cd570194f2f8257da6e1ea9b)
'}]
commit_message:
Correct concurrency of gabbi tests for gabbi 1.22.0

When running gabbi under testr, concurrency grouping is controlled
by a regex in .testr.conf. A module name change in gabbi 1.22.0
inadvertently broke the grouping. This change should work for
old and new versions.

Change-Id: I9c875d8c73ccdfe633279914259061a8c3a7bf3d
(cherry picked from commit 86e94d9ab2b46080cd570194f2f8257da6e1ea9b)

subject: Update tox configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-18 06:47:20.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Update tox configuration

In order to prepare for implementing requirements management by the
OpenStack requirements management process this patch implements
some changes to the tox configuration:

- The minimum tox version is increased in order to be able to use
  constraints for the python packages.
- The OpenStack upper-constraints are used when preparing the test
  venv for the linters checks.
- Any proxy environment variables set on the test host are passed
  into the venv to enable testing from behind a proxy.
- The environment variables used by Ansible tests are moved into
  a new venv called 'ansible' and this environment is inherited
  by all Ansible-related tests.
- The docs test will clean-up an existing build directory before
  executing the docs build.
- The releasenotes build cannot use upper-constraints at this point,
  so it doesn't.
- The Ansible role download will no longer ignore errors so that any
  problems discovered will result in a failed test.

Change-Id: I2ef319e48a4106d911e2ceaddce2c17094ac1aa7
"}]
commit_message:
Update tox configuration

In order to prepare for implementing requirements management by the
OpenStack requirements management process this patch implements
some changes to the tox configuration:

- The minimum tox version is increased in order to be able to use
  constraints for the python packages.
- The OpenStack upper-constraints are used when preparing the test
  venv for the linters checks.
- Any proxy environment variables set on the test host are passed
  into the venv to enable testing from behind a proxy.
- The environment variables used by Ansible tests are moved into
  a new venv called 'ansible' and this environment is inherited
  by all Ansible-related tests.
- The docs test will clean-up an existing build directory before
  executing the docs build.
- The releasenotes build cannot use upper-constraints at this point,
  so it doesn't.
- The Ansible role download will no longer ignore errors so that any
  problems discovered will result in a failed test.

Change-Id: I2ef319e48a4106d911e2ceaddce2c17094ac1aa7

When deploying the overcloud with the default value of 4GB of RAM the overcloud fails throwing "Cannot allocate memory" errors.

commit_message:
Overcloud is not able to deploy with the default 4GB of RAM using instack-undercloud

When deploying the overcloud with the default value of 4GB of RAM the overcloud fails throwing "Cannot allocate memory" errors.
By increasing the default memory to 5GB the error is solved in instack-undercloud

Change-Id: I29036edeebefc1959643a04c5396e72863fdca5f
Closes-Bug: #1563750
(cherry picked from commit 2dec7d7521799c0323d076cd66ba71ebb444c706)

subject: keystone: fix a race condition in bootstrap
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-18 18:25:35.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/pacemaker/keystone.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/keystone.pp'], 'message': "keystone: fix a race condition in bootstrap

Before, we had bootstrap_master set to 'undef' by default that was
used to whether or not run keystone bootstrap exec during deployment.

Setting the value to undef was a mistake, because enable_bootstrap in
puppet-keystone is set to true by default, so bootstrap was running
on all controllers at step 4 for HA scenario, while we want it to run on
a single controller (pacemaker_master) at step 4, like we do for
db-sync.

This patch:

* removes bootstrap_master.
* re-use sync_db to whether or not run keystone bootstrap.
  so it will only run on a single node when database is ready and
  db-sync done (orchestration dones by anchors in puppet-keystone).

Change-Id: I1042862f7c346d1c358b908c33eae0f33afd5e9f
"}]
commit_message:
keystone: fix a race condition in bootstrap

Before, we had bootstrap_master set to 'undef' by default that was
used to whether or not run keystone bootstrap exec during deployment.

Setting the value to undef was a mistake, because enable_bootstrap in
puppet-keystone is set to true by default, so bootstrap was running
on all controllers at step 4 for HA scenario, while we want it to run on
a single controller (pacemaker_master) at step 4, like we do for
db-sync.

This patch:

* removes bootstrap_master.
* re-use sync_db to whether or not run keystone bootstrap.
  so it will only run on a single node when database is ready and
  db-sync done (orchestration dones by anchors in puppet-keystone).

Change-Id: I1042862f7c346d1c358b908c33eae0f33afd5e9f

Create fullstack integration parts

This patch create the starting point to a fullstack job
that is going to be added to networking-l2gw project and run
by jenkins to run end-to-end tests for the project.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 01:22:26.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/irmc/test_common.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/cimc/test_common.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/amt/test_common.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/oneview/test_management.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/drac/test_common.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/ilo/test_management.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/ilo/test_boot.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/ilo/test_deploy.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/ilo/test_common.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/ucs/test_helper.py'], 'message': "Replace dict.get(key) in drivers/modules/*/ tests

This replaces dict.get(key) with dict[key] in
driver/modules/<vendor> unit tests, since we should
be explicit about whether we expect the key to exist or not.

In particular, we shouldn't be doing
    self.assertIsNone(dict.get(key))
since it will pass if 1. the value is None or 2. if the key isn't
in the dict.

Change-Id: I1d0bc7d5b5561eab4317e47f2d7ef006f9e1cb1f
Partial-Bug: #1590808
"}]
commit_message:
Replace dict.get(key) in drivers/modules/*/ tests

This replaces dict.get(key) with dict[key] in
driver/modules/<vendor> unit tests, since we should
be explicit about whether we expect the key to exist or not.

In particular, we shouldn't be doing
    self.assertIsNone(dict.get(key))
since it will pass if 1. the value is None or 2. if the key isn't
in the dict.

Change-Id: I1d0bc7d5b5561eab4317e47f2d7ef006f9e1cb1f
Partial-Bug: #1590808

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-15 16:05:03.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/dev/dev-quickstart.rst'], 'message': "Document testing an in-review patch with devstack

The method documented at
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/configuration.html#service-repos
doesn't work for services (like Ironic) that use a devstack plugin.
Documenting the right process to use should help new developers (who may
not be familiar with OpenStack infrastructure) become productive
quickly.

Change-Id: I40538306ea81dd356e47e063208ea1b84e6e9b24
"}]
commit_message:
Document testing an in-review patch with devstack

The method documented at
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/configuration.html#service-repos
doesn't work for services (like Ironic) that use a devstack plugin.
Documenting the right process to use should help new developers (who may
not be familiar with OpenStack infrastructure) become productive
quickly.

Change-Id: I40538306ea81dd356e47e063208ea1b84e6e9b24

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-16 08:40:04.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/mysql-wss', 'deployment/puppet/mysql/templates/my.cnf.erb'], 'message': "Backport mysql OCF master choose/SST race fixes

* Fix MySQL RA OCF vars' local scopes
  (cherry picked from commit 0ba5fe8e77cedd552244dd33fe62c2f2147fa629)
* Fix SST check for MySQL OCF RA
  (cherry picked from commit c45eaa298549a2b03d1f3aead8ca92115c817f81)
* Fix possible masters eval
  (cherry picked from commit 958192b151c4a5cef3537eab0813307ea4cbb898)
* Fix mysql ocf sst in progress tracking
  (cherry picked from commit 7232dd03e16f448685066f360fec0b6b231d85e5)
* Fix a race for the xtrabackup-v2 SST
  (cherry picked from commit 3061ef0b584f9e43bc4f6139cf798558b77392ee)
* Prefer the wsrep-recover to get the GTID
  (cherry picked from commit 2c99cb0188ee4762d34bf8421c91ea0764cec389)
* Fix possible masters search

commit_message:
Backport OCF/PAM security limits fixes

* Fix missing OCF logging
  (cherry picked from commit 6d90814c5675353aaf97946a40eb92d55cb9bdb4)
* Remove exit code verification from MySQL OCF
  (cherry picked from commit 14ec4750e763d82ab89f0b315f0d4f1341e893d6)
* Check for Mysql wss constraints among online nodes
  (cherry picked from commit 7050f07fe155e00fd1d3bcbf2658de56c3b25387)
* Refactor MySQL OCF script
  (cherry picked from commit 615a0428e3250cffadbf5ebf61e477e91858cb16)
* Update OCF stop actions to use procfs
  (cherry picked from commit 7c210ee68db112bbd16066a54bfdf462a8bbedbd)
* Fix the proc_kill ocf helper func
  (cherry picked from commit d961691e5fa7ba49305e35a4c17de09b2dae2eb6)
* Add pkill by name to the ocf-fuel-funcs
  (cherry picked from commit d5a370e8eb723dcfa28795b089d9f247f51ef105)
* Apply PAM security limits by running daemons through su
  (cherry picked from commit 65eca547606edceedc15d8fadfd1e5822ba9f1f6)

Change-Id: Ie64b4d89c3e3b9aa360a4175416c866ed1ae2620

Closes-bug: #1524826
Closes-bug: #1542256

Closes-bug: #1429553

Backport OCF/PAM security limits fixes

* Fix missing OCF logging
  (cherry picked from commit 6d90814c5675353aaf97946a40eb92d55cb9bdb4)
* Remove exit code verification from MySQL OCF
  (cherry picked from commit 14ec4750e763d82ab89f0b315f0d4f1341e893d6)

  (cherry picked from commit 7050f07fe155e00fd1d3bcbf2658de56c3b25387)

* Update OCF stop actions to use procfs

  (cherry picked from commit d961691e5fa7ba49305e35a4c17de09b2dae2eb6)

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-06-10 10:50:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/callbacks/exceptions.py', 'neutron/api/api_common.py', 'neutron/common/exceptions.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/test_api_common.py'], 'message': "Convert multiple exception types in the API

The callback framework will collect all exceptions that occur
during the notification loop and raise a single exception
containing all of them. The issue with this is that the code
that notifies has to manually unpack the exceptions and choose
what to reraise for the API layer even if it has no other reason
to catch the exception (i.e. any encountered exceptions should be
fatal). If it doesn't, the server will just return a generic HTTP
500 error to the user even if the internal exception is a normal
error that would convert to a 404, 409, etc.

This patch makes the API exception conversion layer aware of
exceptions containing other exceptions so code no longer has to
catch callback failures if it has no specific error-handling logic.

Multiple exceptions that translate to the same HTTP error code will
be converted into one exception of the same error code with the
details of each exception line-separated in the exception message.

Multiple exceptions that translate to different HTTP error codes will
be concatenated together line-separated with their HTTP error prefixes
into an HTTP Conflict exception.

If there is only a single exception in the multi exception type, the
inner exception is used directly.

Partially-Implements: bp/multi-l3-backends
Change-Id: I528de088079b68cf284ef361fee9bd195125e0d8
"}]
commit_message:
Convert multiple exception types in the API

The callback framework will collect all exceptions that occur
during the notification loop and raise a single exception
containing all of them. The issue with this is that the code
that notifies has to manually unpack the exceptions and choose
what to reraise for the API layer even if it has no other reason
to catch the exception (i.e. any encountered exceptions should be
fatal). If it doesn't, the server will just return a generic HTTP
500 error to the user even if the internal exception is a normal
error that would convert to a 404, 409, etc.

This patch makes the API exception conversion layer aware of
exceptions containing other exceptions so code no longer has to
catch callback failures if it has no specific error-handling logic.

Multiple exceptions that translate to the same HTTP error code will
be converted into one exception of the same error code with the
details of each exception line-separated in the exception message.

Multiple exceptions that translate to different HTTP error codes will
be concatenated together line-separated with their HTTP error prefixes
into an HTTP Conflict exception.

If there is only a single exception in the multi exception type, the
inner exception is used directly.

Partially-Implements: bp/multi-l3-backends
Change-Id: I528de088079b68cf284ef361fee9bd195125e0d8

commit_message:
libvirt: deprecate use_usb_tablet in favor of pointer_model

A new global option to handle input devices has
been introduced. The specifc option use_usb_tablet in the
group libvirt has been depecreated for Newton and should be
removed for O*

Related-To: blueprint virt-configure-usb-tablet-from-image
Change-Id: I51186530a94d86c8ed14783c7d42d0a3bd601f59

commit_message:
Support for MultipleExceptions in db_api decorators

This adds support for checking for Deadlocks inside
of multiple exception types to the db api retry
mechanisms. This allows us to catch Deadlock errors
that occur inside of callbacks with uncaught exceptions.

Partially-Implements: bp/multi-l3-backends
Change-Id: I88fd45ee8ee694c6ae8c3e83ec7388953a65791e

subject: Fix config generated for rsyslog_client_log_files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-15 13:17:27.000000000', 'files': ['templates/99-rsyslog.conf.j2', 'tasks/rsyslog_client_post_install.yml', 'templates/os_aggregate_storage.j2'], 'message': 'Fix config generated for rsyslog_client_log_files

The rsyslog_client_log_files role variable was masked by the
rsyslog_client_log_files fact set during the post install task. This
caused the log files set in the rsyslog_client_log_files variable to be
ignored on the second or later invocation of the rsyslog_client role.
Instead the log files discovered from rsyslog_client_dir on previous
runs of the role were add to the list of logfiles. This resulted in
missing rsyslog configurations and duplicate logrotate entries.

Change-Id: I00a58def426a4f30f1e64a24320ee68157b95f24
'}]
commit_message:
Fix config generated for rsyslog_client_log_files

The rsyslog_client_log_files role variable was masked by the
rsyslog_client_log_files fact set during the post install task. This
caused the log files set in the rsyslog_client_log_files variable to be
ignored on the second or later invocation of the rsyslog_client role.
Instead the log files discovered from rsyslog_client_dir on previous
runs of the role were add to the list of logfiles. This resulted in
missing rsyslog configurations and duplicate logrotate entries.

Change-Id: I00a58def426a4f30f1e64a24320ee68157b95f24

commit_message:
Add Google Container Registry to KubernetesCluster

Allow access to Google Container Registry using json key as
a password for docker login. The key is scoped to a specific
Google Cloud Platform Console project and its resources.
Add new field for key.

Partially implements: blueprint k8s-google-registry-support

Change-Id: Ica71d1a48ac7fb75a71497fcbe318d1b9e4e8192

revisions:
[{'number': 22, 'created': '2016-06-16 13:15:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/exception.py', 'nova/objects/resource_provider.py', 'nova/tests/functional/db/test_resource_provider.py'], 'message': "Add set_inventory() method on ResourceProvider

Adds a set_inventory() method on the ResourceProvider object that
replaces the resource provider's inventory with a supplied set of
inventory records in an InventoryList object. The replacement is done in
a consistent fashion using the resource provider's generation value to
ensure that a writer doesn't update the inventory of a resource provider
after another writer has changed the inventory in between the original
read of inventory information and the subsequent save of that inventory.

A functional test is in place which attempts to exercise all three
of add, delete and update inventory as well as causing a
ConcurrentUpdateException.

form.

Change-Id: I2214fa5d176269e65fdcd7a5a7e4958a925235d3
"}]
commit_message:
Add set_inventory() method on ResourceProvider

Adds a set_inventory() method on the ResourceProvider object that
replaces the resource provider's inventory with a supplied set of
inventory records in an InventoryList object. The replacement is done in
a consistent fashion using the resource provider's generation value to
ensure that a writer doesn't update the inventory of a resource provider
after another writer has changed the inventory in between the original
read of inventory information and the subsequent save of that inventory.

A functional test is in place which attempts to exercise all three
of add, delete and update inventory as well as causing a
ConcurrentUpdateException.

The object hash has changed but no version increment done because
the ResourceProvider object is not yet in use in the wild. These
changes are still bringing the eventual first version to its correct
form.

Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
Change-Id: I2214fa5d176269e65fdcd7a5a7e4958a925235d3

commit_message:
Use the correct action for failure reason

Use `action` from ResourceFailure exception, if available, as
there are cases like update restriction check, where we don't
update the resource action yet.

Change-Id: I5d43c220669c7a9e8d7dbce6611e062101f8b86b
Closes-Bug: #1592631

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 12.0.16

This patch includes updates of any changed paste, policy and rootwrap
configurations. It also includes updates to the pip, wheel and
setuptools pins. Finally, it also updates the required roles and
copies any release notes from those roles.

Additional updated include:
- The get-pypi-pkg-version script is set to use https instead of
  http.
- The ansible-role-requirements-editor.py script is added to facilitate
  automated updates of the ansible-role-requirements file.
- The sources-branch-updater is updated to automate the updates to
  ansible-role-requirements, and to automatically increment the release
  version.
- The test-requirements are updated to match the current stable/liberty
  requirements from the OpenStack requirements repository using
  global-requirements

Change-Id: Ib6cc4703192cda7c9dce662a70d1e0e1bbcb6e4c

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 13.1.4

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Additional updated include:
- The Ironic git source repository name is updated to os_ironic
  and set to use git.openstack.org
- The get-pypi-pkg-version script is set to use https instead of
  http
- The sources-branch-updater script is changed to remove the
  workaround for the Ironic repo name mismatch
- The test-requirements are updated to match the current
  stable/mitaka requirements from the OpenStack requirements
  repository using global-requirements
- Sets the sources-branch-updater to use the branch/topic
  'sha-update' when updating the files/templates in each role
  repository.

Change-Id: I9da9f3924484c2a27b280e0cab01f515e37fd57b

(cherry picked from commit 90237b043fa69de3e7a35262fe6bdfba5c449e9a)

commit_message:
Only match full IP addresses in /etc/hosts

Include the space in after the IP address in the match string to avoid
matching IP addreses which only differ in an addtional digit at the end.
With the previous logic an entry for 10.1.1.1 would also delete entries
for 10.1.1.12 or 10.1.1.123.

Change-Id: I797ff261630f4115b3852138c19eb039303e27c6
(cherry picked from commit 90237b043fa69de3e7a35262fe6bdfba5c449e9a)

subject: Refactor pip_install to support offline deployment
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-06-12 21:45:28.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/install_offline.yml', 'tasks/install_online.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/install-local-019edab04ffc8347.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Refactor pip_install to support offline deployment

Optionally support the download and installation of pip and its dependencies
via the deployment host to remove the dependence of internet connectivity on
remote containers.

When pip_offline_install is true, download get-pip.py and the pip
installation wheels to the deployment host. These wheels along with get-pip.py
are copied to the remote container and the installation is performed
offline.

Change-Id: Ic6583c54976b6fb083d9c67d055897c15bce05dc
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor pip_install to support offline deployment

Optionally support the download and installation of pip and its dependencies
via the deployment host to remove the dependence of internet connectivity on
remote containers.

When pip_offline_install is true, download get-pip.py and the pip
installation wheels to the deployment host. These wheels along with get-pip.py
are copied to the remote container and the installation is performed
offline.

Change-Id: Ic6583c54976b6fb083d9c67d055897c15bce05dc

commit_message:
Only match full IP addresses in /etc/hosts

Include the space in after the IP address in the match string to avoid
matching IP addreses which only differ in an addtional digit at the end.
With the previous logic an entry for 10.1.1.1 would also delete entries
for 10.1.1.12 or 10.1.1.123.

Change-Id: I797ff261630f4115b3852138c19eb039303e27c6
(cherry picked from commit 90237b043fa69de3e7a35262fe6bdfba5c449e9a)

commit_message:
Mark several cleanup resources as tenant_resource

Nova servers and security groups are tenant related resources,
but resource decorator missed that fact which makes cleanup
tries to delete one resources several times.

Change-Id: Ie3a0a40c2282fc7cffa33f1efe5d37601a461709
Closes-Bug: #1584104

commit_message:
3PAR driver failure SR License missing in array

This patch performs check if the array supports System Reporter and
depending on this license, performs call to _update_volume_stats()
at initialization.
Added unit test to verify get_volume_stats() when SR lic missing

Closes-Bug: #1568078
(cherry picked from commit 125a900815684b973788cc7a3c9d9ed8232cc2c4)

Change-Id: Ifb1bb4552254ed1e790600fab80fcc7aa76b8a38

commit_message:
Add README for api-ref

In the neutron stadium, we maintain the networking API reference
in neutron-lib repository. It is different from other projects,
so it would be helpful for contributors if we have README in the
usual location (neutron/api-ref).

Depends-On: I6f2c4d476c31b252bfb181138505673f397639fc
Change-Id: I41dc58e5edfd18a52f13f042ba865b82fad764f7

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-06-16 01:52:22.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/flashsystem_common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/flashsystem_iscsi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/flashsystem_fc.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_ibm_flashsystem_iscsi.py'], 'message': "IBM FlashSystem: Add host check for iSCSI driver

If host was deleted by others, the deleted host still exist in hosts.
In _find_host_exhaustive(), all hosts would been enumerated. Thus, if no
host exists in FlashSystem, 'lshost' command will failed. But if other
host(s) exists, wrong host will be returned.

In this fix,
* Add hostname check before issue 'lshost' command for iSCSI.
* Bump version to 1.0.10.

Change-Id: Ic7c7b397293102e864adcbe78770b3a620e2f72a
Close-bug: 1585085
"}]
commit_message:
IBM FlashSystem: Add host check for iSCSI driver

If host was deleted by others, the deleted host still exist in hosts.
In _find_host_exhaustive(), all hosts would been enumerated. Thus, if no
host exists in FlashSystem, 'lshost' command will failed. But if other
host(s) exists, wrong host will be returned.

In this fix,
* Add hostname check before issue 'lshost' command for iSCSI.
* Bump version to 1.0.10.

Change-Id: Ic7c7b397293102e864adcbe78770b3a620e2f72a
Close-bug: 1585085

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-18 12:35:48.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_compute_kvm_install.yml'], 'message': "Fix shell command usage

In https://review.openstack.org/320624 a method of providing the
shell module arguments was used which breaks ansible-lint (and
is improper anyway). The lint check did not effectively catch
this. The lint check not working will be resolved in another
patch. This patch fixes the task's syntax to ensure that fixed
lint checks implemented in other repositories do not fail on
this role.

Change-Id: If62fed46937193c0868ca2c9d2b4c29bfd331c59
"}]
commit_message:
Fix shell command usage

In https://review.openstack.org/320624 a method of providing the
shell module arguments was used which breaks ansible-lint (and
is improper anyway). The lint check did not effectively catch
this. The lint check not working will be resolved in another
patch. This patch fixes the task's syntax to ensure that fixed
lint checks implemented in other repositories do not fail on
this role.

Change-Id: If62fed46937193c0868ca2c9d2b4c29bfd331c59

revisions:

ready for micro-services.

Note: a future iteration will deploy nova-compute libvirt parameters

Change-Id: I7461b01fdb96be59c8e0c55c21882d86582e54d0
Depends-On: I2ff3cf6a31bc10aa46a089fcbfc654eda55e6ef8
Depends-On: I1a1cb827512b12289558b296a7e64ce2dc71f00a
"}]
commit_message:
Enable libvirt as a micro-service

Deploy compute nodes using both libvirt & nova-compute profiles, both
ready for micro-services.

Note: a future iteration will deploy nova-compute libvirt parameters
like we do with Neutron plugins, so we'll be able to easily plug other
backends (VMware, etc). Until then default the nova-compute service to
use libvirt.

Change-Id: I7461b01fdb96be59c8e0c55c21882d86582e54d0
Depends-On: I2ff3cf6a31bc10aa46a089fcbfc654eda55e6ef8
Depends-On: I1a1cb827512b12289558b296a7e64ce2dc71f00a

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-16 13:27:19.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_agent_base_vendor.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/api/v1/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_rpcapi.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_utils.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_snmp.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py'], 'message': 'Use assertIn and assertNotIn

Tests should use:
  self.assertIn(value, list)
  self.assertNotIn(value, list)

instead of:
  self.assertTrue(value in list)
  self.assertFalse(value in list)

because assertIn and assertNotIn raise more meaningful errors:
  self.assertIn(3, [1, 2]
  >>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]

  self.assertTrue(3 in [1, 2])
  >>> AssertionError: False is not true

Change-Id: Ic2461afd9872767fe615064610daffb52e743388
Closes-Bug: #1510007
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertIn and assertNotIn

Tests should use:
  self.assertIn(value, list)
  self.assertNotIn(value, list)

instead of:
  self.assertTrue(value in list)
  self.assertFalse(value in list)

because assertIn and assertNotIn raise more meaningful errors:
  self.assertIn(3, [1, 2]
  >>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]

  self.assertTrue(3 in [1, 2])
  >>> AssertionError: False is not true

Change-Id: Ic2461afd9872767fe615064610daffb52e743388
Closes-Bug: #1510007

commit_message:
Use assertIn and assertNotIn

Tests should use:
  self.assertIn(value, list)
  self.assertNotIn(value, list)

instead of:
  self.assertTrue(value in list)
  self.assertFalse(value in list)

because assertIn and assertNotIn raise more meaningful errors:
  self.assertIn(3, [1, 2]
  >>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]

  self.assertTrue(3 in [1, 2])
  >>> AssertionError: False is not true

Change-Id: I2d1c78fe71fe03e350b1035123b0a48b7186a6ec
Closes-Bug: #1510007

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 20:10:28.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_virt_detect.yml'], 'message': 'Always execute Nova virt type detection

This fix executes the nova virt type detection on any playbook run
and will eliminate the need to specify the nova-cpuinfo-read,
nova-virt-type-set tags along with the intended tag like nova-config.

Change-Id: Ic34011149f1355cfa48f4ee35537362e2d24e55d
Closes-Bug: #1587452
(cherry picked from commit a8d1e412ef8af4ac345c5f926e37b741aa7a1adb)

commit_message:
Always execute Nova virt type detection

This fix executes the nova virt type detection on any playbook run
and will eliminate the need to specify the nova-cpuinfo-read,
nova-virt-type-set tags along with the intended tag like nova-config.

Change-Id: Ic34011149f1355cfa48f4ee35537362e2d24e55d
Closes-Bug: #1587452
(cherry picked from commit a8d1e412ef8af4ac345c5f926e37b741aa7a1adb)

commit_message:
Address FutureWarning for invalid UUIDs

Ensure that the following warning does not appear in the tests:

    FutureWarning: test-tenant is an invalid UUID. Using
    UUIDFields with invalid UUIDs is no longer supported,
    and will be removed in a future release. Please update
    your code to input valid UUIDs or accept ValueErrors
    for invalid UUIDs. See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField
    for further details

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ie34627380526734e3d6895859e7805f3023ddc78

commit_message:
adopt neutron_lib for constants and exceptions

Neutron-lib decomposition[1] effort moves constants and exceptions
from neutron to neutron-lib. In Newton cycle, those will be
eliminated from neutron repo. and neutron stadium evolution[2]
requires networking-odl to use neutron-lib.
This patch makes use of neutron_lib for constants and exceptions
instead of neutron ones.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/liberty/neutron-lib.html
[2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/newton/neutron-stadium.html

Change-Id: I255652cb029a66ba22ccdc71332e5884783bcc2d

commit_message:
Add sync_all process into v2 driver init

This is the first patch, which verify the the ODL cold reboot detection
when init and implement the basic resource sync function. Thread pool
implementaion will not be included.

This patch introduces a new table opendaylightsync which works as a
state machine/lock to trigger the actual sync process in journal thread
by monitor thread.

Change-Id: I028b39490fc6a994e5ee7a723de502f62ccbc814
Close-Bug: #1540205

commit_message:
Address Ansible bare variable usage

When executing the role with Ansible 2.1, the following
deprecation warning is issued in the output for some tasks.

[DEPRECATION WARNING]: Using bare variables is deprecated.

This patch addresses the tasks to fix the behaviour appropriately.

Change-Id: I8ccbeca6b9aa869cb87a7219feff1a2715efa9c6

commit_message:
Compute IPAvailabilityRanges in memory during IP allocation

This patch computes IP availability in memory without locking on
IPAvailabilityRanges. IP availability is generated in memory, and
to avoid contention an IP address is selected by randomly
selecting from within the first 10 available IP addresses on a
subnet. Raises IPAddressGenerationFailure if unable to allocate an
IP address from within the window.

Change-Id: I52e4485e832cbe6798de6b4afb6a7cfd88db11e2
Depends-On: I84195b0eb63b7ca6a4e00becbe09e579ff8b718e
Closes-Bug: #1543094

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-09 14:41:59.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/trunk/models.py', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/newton/expand/5abc0278ca73_add_support_for_vlan_trunking.py'], 'message': "Clean up subports model

First, the nullable attribute on port_id was redundant because it is
in the primary key.

Second, trunk_id shouldn't be in the primary key.  Since port_id was
already marked unique, it didn't add any extra uniqueness constraint
and it doesn't help to have it in a primary key index either since
we'll either search the table for a given port_id *or* search for
subports with a given trunk_id.

The original model was not released in Mitaka.  Also, this is
effectively a cosmetic change, it doesn't really effect the operation
of the DB.  So, developers and trunk chasers who have deployed with
the previous model will still work.

Change-Id: Ia43a2a772f654e26c3234e153fd8a5501e585c9b
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up subports model

First, the nullable attribute on port_id was redundant because it is
in the primary key.

Second, trunk_id shouldn't be in the primary key.  Since port_id was
already marked unique, it didn't add any extra uniqueness constraint
and it doesn't help to have it in a primary key index either since
we'll either search the table for a given port_id *or* search for
subports with a given trunk_id.

The original model was not released in Mitaka.  Also, this is
effectively a cosmetic change, it doesn't really effect the operation
of the DB.  So, developers and trunk chasers who have deployed with
the previous model will still work.

Change-Id: Ia43a2a772f654e26c3234e153fd8a5501e585c9b
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

commit_message:
After a migration clean up the floating ip on the source host

When a VM is migrated that has a floating IP associated, the L3
agent on the source host should be notified when the migration
is over. If the router on the source host is not going to be
removed (there are other ports using it) then we should nofity
that the floating IP needs to be cleaned up.

Change-Id: Iad6fbad06cdd33380ef536e6360fd90375ed380d
Closes-bug: #1585165

commit_message:
Add meaningful default address-space names

Address-scopes are not mandatory for creating subnetpools and subnets in
neutron. Currently we are not using neutron address-scopes in Kuryr so
same should be reflected in config names also.

Change-Id: I07f1554623f844ac13b2606adff566e70de47940
Closes-bug: #1590330

Closes-Bug: #1585373

commit_message:
Fix update of shared QoS policy

When user updates QoS policy which is globaly shared, it will be still
marked as globally shared even if this flag was not set explicitly
in update request.
For example, updating description of QoS policy will not change shared
flag to default value which is "False".

Co-Authored-By: Haim Daniel <hdaniel@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I2c59e71eae0bf2e73475bba321afc4aaa514b317
Closes-Bug: #1585373

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-08 04:26:19.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/driver.py'], 'message': "WIP: Replication CG Integration Phase 1

In phase 1 of the replication CG integration, we are making
changes in the replication functions of the volume manager
and driver to handle volumes in a replication CG. No Cinder
API change is involved in this phase.

Spec is proposed here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/229722/

Here are the steps to create a replication CG:

- Admin sets up volume type A that supports replication and CG.
  volume_type_A must have the following extra_spec as well as other
  things required by the driver:

      replication_enabled: <is> True

- User creates a CG with the potential to support replication by
  specifying volume_type_A.

cinder consisgroup-create --name 'replication_cg' volume_type_A

The scheduler will choose a backend that reports both
consistencygroup_support = True and replication_enabled = True.

- User creates a volume and adds to CG.

cinder create --name 'replication_cg_vol_1'
              --volume-type volume_type_A
              --consisgroup-id <CG uuid>

- Repeat until all volumes are created for the CG.

- Enable replication CG, assuming the CLI is as follows:

cinder replication-enable <volume uuid>

This will enable replication for all volumes in the replication CG.

The above example starts with an empty CG. For other cases such as
create CG from source, update CG, etc., I think we need to make a
few more changes to prevent user error.

Co-Authored-By: xing-yang <xing.yang@emc.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Griffith <john.griffith8@gmailcom>

Change-Id: Ic96fcf0beb84f3b6c651d7ea271c96ba5e953ba9
implements: blueprint replication-cg
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Replication CG Integration Phase 1

In phase 1 of the replication CG integration, we are making
changes in the replication functions of the volume manager
and driver to handle volumes in a replication CG. No Cinder
API change is involved in this phase.

Spec is proposed here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/229722/

Here are the steps to create a replication CG:

- Admin sets up volume type A that supports replication and CG.
  volume_type_A must have the following extra_spec as well as other
  things required by the driver:

      replication_enabled: <is> True

- User creates a CG with the potential to support replication by
  specifying volume_type_A.

cinder consisgroup-create --name 'replication_cg' volume_type_A

The scheduler will choose a backend that reports both
consistencygroup_support = True and replication_enabled = True.

- User creates a volume and adds to CG.

cinder create --name 'replication_cg_vol_1'
              --volume-type volume_type_A
              --consisgroup-id <CG uuid>

- Repeat until all volumes are created for the CG.

- Enable replication CG, assuming the CLI is as follows:

cinder replication-enable <volume uuid>

This will enable replication for all volumes in the replication CG.

The above example starts with an empty CG. For other cases such as
create CG from source, update CG, etc., I think we need to make a
few more changes to prevent user error.

Co-Authored-By: xing-yang <xing.yang@emc.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Griffith <john.griffith8@gmailcom>

Change-Id: Ic96fcf0beb84f3b6c651d7ea271c96ba5e953ba9
implements: blueprint replication-cg

segment module is imported from neutron.extensions, but a variable
segment is used in _validate_segment shadowing the module name.

This patch renamed the variable to segment_model to avoid the shadowing.

Change-Id: I066256b0a17500f0db41035f191c69d7a49f527c
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed variable shadowing in ipam_backend_mixin.py

segment module is imported from neutron.extensions, but a variable
segment is used in _validate_segment shadowing the module name.

This patch renamed the variable to segment_model to avoid the shadowing.

commit_message:
Add type information to ObjectNotFound message

This patch improves the ObjectNotFound exception message thrown by
Neutron objects DB API.

Before:
Object subnet_id:: 8426f11e-fef0-4432-af46-94c7177ee742\
 address:: fhbjxrjhsq  not found.

After:
Object DNSNameServer(subnet_id=8426f11e-fef0-4432-af46-94c7177ee742,\
 address=fhbjxrjhsq) not found.

Change-Id: Iab49666bc30409d81556c529317f060d59671c5f
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

subject: Fix az parameter handling which blocks the integration test
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-06-17 02:28:28.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/tests/functional/cinder_apigw/controllers/test_volume.py', 'tricircle/cinder_apigw/controllers/volume.py', 'tricircle/common/az_ag.py'], 'message': "Fix az parameter handling which blocks the integration test

1.What is the problem:
If availability zone (az in short) does not exit in the volume creation
request, 400 bad request was given in current handling, this handling is
incorrect and will block the following integration test cases:
ostestr --regex tempest.api.volume.test_volumes_list
ostestr --regex tempest.api.volume.test_volumes_get

Refer to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329300/

2.What's need to be fixed:
To fix the issue, volume creation should allow no az parameter in
the request, and select one default bottom pod to continue the volume
creation.

3.What is the purpose of this patch set:
To make the integration test being the gate test of each patch set after
The Tricircle integration test Jenkins job is configured in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329740/

Change-Id: I8ee1cd5741605fbb105e2f24258459516aa7c5c0
"}]
commit_message:
Fix az parameter handling which blocks the integration test

1.What is the problem:
If availability zone (az in short) does not exit in the volume creation
request, 400 bad request was given in current handling, this handling is
incorrect and will block the following integration test cases:
ostestr --regex tempest.api.volume.test_volumes_list
ostestr --regex tempest.api.volume.test_volumes_get

Refer to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329300/

2.What's need to be fixed:
To fix the issue, volume creation should allow no az parameter in
the request, and select one default bottom pod to continue the volume
creation.

3.What is the purpose of this patch set:
To make the integration test being the gate test of each patch set after
The Tricircle integration test Jenkins job is configured in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329740/

Change-Id: I8ee1cd5741605fbb105e2f24258459516aa7c5c0

subject: Fix gnu tar error handling
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-17 16:17:31.000000000', 'files': ['freezer/engine/tar/tar_engine.py'], 'message': "Fix gnu tar error handling

Make gnu tar backup and restore error handling work correctly.
Check stderr from gnu tar subprocess for any non-empty string.
Current implementation checks for 'error' string in stderr,
and fails to catch and log errors.

Change sys.exit(1) to os._exit(1) when handling gnu tar error
so that all threads terminate. Currently the process will
hang because all threads are not terminated when a gnu tar
error occurs. os_exit(1) will terminate all threads
and the entire process when a gnu tar error occurs.

Change-Id: Icf265ade8d5e4c9b55aee50faa40334d89d664f1
Closes-Bug: #1591347
(cherry picked from commit 75f2c9db3589e729ac2a522961cc12799eea87db)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix gnu tar error handling

Make gnu tar backup and restore error handling work correctly.
Check stderr from gnu tar subprocess for any non-empty string.
Current implementation checks for 'error' string in stderr,
and fails to catch and log errors.

Change sys.exit(1) to os._exit(1) when handling gnu tar error
so that all threads terminate. Currently the process will
hang because all threads are not terminated when a gnu tar
error occurs. os_exit(1) will terminate all threads
and the entire process when a gnu tar error occurs.

Change-Id: Icf265ade8d5e4c9b55aee50faa40334d89d664f1
Closes-Bug: #1591347
(cherry picked from commit 75f2c9db3589e729ac2a522961cc12799eea87db)

commit_message:
objects: in get_object(s), filter by fields, not model attributes

This is needed for objects that have fields that have different names
comparing to corresponding attributes in the database. Updated test
cases to reflect that behaviour (pass field filters into object
get_object(s), but expect db_api functions to receive and return model
attributes).

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
(WIP)DVR: Clean stale snat_namespace with gw_port remove

This patch adds an exists method to the namespace class
so that the namespace can be validated for its existence
and then necessary action can be taken when gateway is
added, removed or updated.

Also do the necessary cleanup of the stale namespaces if
the agent is dead while gateway remove and then when agent
comes alive.

Change-Id: I4ecac248cbb1b7f72158abaa36645b13caab9aa1
Closes-Bug: #1590041
Closes-Bug: #1557909

commit_message:
Add release note for Mongo to Galera changes

The upgrade note describes only that which needs to happen
without specifying details so that an upgrade play in the
integrated repository can be optionally revised into this
message easily. It might also be left unsaid with the
upgrade docs and the upgrade play being self-evident.

Change-Id: I86a2f6f084c3c5de4b506c999eb54531527e8bed

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-06-09 07:33:07.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/agents_db.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/callbacks/exceptions.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/callbacks/version_manager.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/callbacks/test_version_manager.py', 'doc/source/devref/rpc_callbacks.rst', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_agents_db.py'], 'message': 'Refactor the rpc callback version discovery mechanism

The previous version depended on the AgentDbMixin to be loaded by
any plugin, and also introduced an __init__ on the mixin which
was problematic: mixins are expected to be classes which add methods
to another class, but to implement no constructor. One of the plugins
had one of the elements of MRO not calling to super().__init__ and
hence not triggering this __init__ method.

This change requires the plugins using the rpc callback mechanism
to provide the AgentDbMixin which is used to refresh cache of known
resource consumers (agents) and versions on demand, this way
we make it more clear that the rpc_callback api is currently designed
to be used with agents only, despite of its extensibility to other
areas.

Change-Id: Ie96b52dbe3a1f32cd4c11de8d8a5eff663fbf7f6
Related-Bug: #1584204
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor the rpc callback version discovery mechanism

The previous version depended on the AgentDbMixin to be loaded by
any plugin, and also introduced an __init__ on the mixin which
was problematic: mixins are expected to be classes which add methods
to another class, but to implement no constructor. One of the plugins
had one of the elements of MRO not calling to super().__init__ and
hence not triggering this __init__ method.

This change requires the plugins using the rpc callback mechanism
to provide the AgentDbMixin which is used to refresh cache of known
resource consumers (agents) and versions on demand, this way
we make it more clear that the rpc_callback api is currently designed
to be used with agents only, despite of its extensibility to other
areas.

Change-Id: Ie96b52dbe3a1f32cd4c11de8d8a5eff663fbf7f6
Related-Bug: #1584204

With the concept of segments being introduced, the dhcp agent

Because networks may or may not be made up of segments,  segment_id is
being added to the networkdhcpagentbindings table as a NULLable column.

commit_message:
Add segment_id to DHCP Agent Network Bindings

With the concept of segments being introduced, the dhcp agent
scheduler needs to be aware of networks that are made up of segments.
Because networks may or may not be made up of segments,  segment_id is
being added to the networkdhcpagentbindings table as a NULLable column.
It is expected, for now, that every segment MUST have a dhcp agent
scheduled to it, and an agent cannot be scheduled to more than one
segment.  These two stipulations may change in the future, but they
are assumed for now.

Change-Id: If1f38fd8583a99a7b65cdb98b6e2a077ccf20863
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Revert 'Adding keystoneauth sessions support'

This did not work when OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE was set to internalURL. It
always returned the publicURL.

This also always made a query to keystone for the monasca_api_url
even when the session client did not need it. The extra query will
hurt performance

Change-Id: I3d890949941acc77a17888ec57274d9201eb56a1

commit_message:

This change updates the aodh role to support Ubuntu 14.04 with
upstart init and 16.04 with a systemd init.

Some tags for tasks are updated to conform to convention as well.

Updated *_domain_id to "Default"

"default" which causes an error in environments using PostgreSQL or
case-sensirive MySQL as DB backend.

Closes-Bug: #1580611

[{'number': 18, 'created': '2016-06-18 01:38:08.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/add-network-versions-client-d90e8334e1443f5c.yaml', 'tempest/lib/services/network/versions_client.py', 'tempest/clients.py', 'tempest/api/network/base.py', 'tempest/tests/lib/services/network/test_versions_client.py', 'tempest/api/network/test_versions.py'], 'message': 'Add simple test for Neutron GET /

A fundamental operation for most OpenStack services is providing
information about what versions of an API are available to clients.
A version document can be retrieved by sending an unauthenticated
GET request to the root URL ("/") for most services, including
Neutron.  This capability is important for discovery in that clients
can learn how to interact with the cloud in question, and DefCore
considers it an important capability for interoperability and has
added similar capabilities to it's Guidelines for other services.[1][2]
As Neutron moves toward microversioning [3], being able to retrieve
a version document will be increasingly important for clients.
However, there are currently no tests for GET /, so DefCore cannot
make this a required Capability.

This patch adds a simple test for GET / that performs checks on
document structure and version information.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/defcore/tree/2016.01.json#n117
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/defcore/tree/2016.01.json#n1379
[3] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/newton-neutron-future-neutron-api

Closes-Bug: #1577410

Change-Id: I606b98cb6648bd4dd45f0dfdd634b1012aeae2ac
'}]
commit_message:
Add simple test for Neutron GET /

A fundamental operation for most OpenStack services is providing
information about what versions of an API are available to clients.
A version document can be retrieved by sending an unauthenticated
GET request to the root URL ("/") for most services, including
Neutron.  This capability is important for discovery in that clients
can learn how to interact with the cloud in question, and DefCore
considers it an important capability for interoperability and has
added similar capabilities to it's Guidelines for other services.[1][2]
As Neutron moves toward microversioning [3], being able to retrieve
a version document will be increasingly important for clients.
However, there are currently no tests for GET /, so DefCore cannot
make this a required Capability.

This patch adds a simple test for GET / that performs checks on
document structure and version information.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/defcore/tree/2016.01.json#n117
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/defcore/tree/2016.01.json#n1379
[3] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/newton-neutron-future-neutron-api

Closes-Bug: #1577410

Change-Id: I606b98cb6648bd4dd45f0dfdd634b1012aeae2ac

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-16 22:31:57.000000000', 'files': ['kolla_kubernetes/service.py'], 'message': "Create ConfigMaps with dashes instead of underscores

Kubernetes doesn't like underscores in ConfigMap files.  We can't
change all of the config files, especially if that's what the
process running inside of the container wants.  Thus, we create
them with dashes replacing the underscores and then fix it when
we create the configmap.

Change-Id: I530fbd530814da221e85932a8b88651aa122ce7d
"}]
commit_message:
Create ConfigMaps with dashes instead of underscores

Kubernetes doesn't like underscores in ConfigMap files.  We can't
change all of the config files, especially if that's what the
process running inside of the container wants.  Thus, we create
them with dashes replacing the underscores and then fix it when
we create the configmap.

Change-Id: I530fbd530814da221e85932a8b88651aa122ce7d

Create Rabbitmq admin user for web administration

This patch enables rabbitmq_server role to create an admin user for the
web management UI.  The user is only created if a
rabbitmq_admin_pasword variable is defined.

New variables created:

rabbitmq_admin_user

commit_message:
Add compute node on the go

While working on multi-node network, when we need more
computation power, it is difficult to add compute node.
So we wish to provide a way to automatically add compute
node on the go.

Change-Id: I81155d9e5b6760d4ab0adcbe7519320a1344c122
Implements: blueprint Add compute node on the go

commit_message:
Added role for mounting the drives in swift object

Currently in any of the release of openstack-ansible (swift),
I don't find any role to mount the drives in swift object server nodes.
I think if the user knows the type of the file system that is
going to be used, we can mount the drives as well using
the playbook without manual intervention.

Change-Id: Iec9b0df9300b7b334f89a680cba06e30ec67af6f
Closes-Bug: #1535536

commit_message:
modify how services are configured in haproxy

Currently haproxy play add all services to its
configurations even in the case where some will
not be deployed later. To remove this issue,
this patch brings the haproxy service
configurations at the beggining of each service
installation playbook.

Change-Id: I74e51fb116ece266384d8588ad0ef125b3eed6a2

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-04 15:40:12.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/openstack_hosts/templates/sysstat.default.j2'], 'message': 'Store openstack_host_systat_enabled as lower case value for sysstat.default.j2

Sysstat won't enable unless the ENABLED switch has been set to true.
Passing openstack_host_systat_enabled as true inside jinja will end
up as a "True" value inside the /etc/default/sysstat rather then the
expected "true" value and sysstat won't start.

The added jinja filter lower will make sure that the boolean is always
stored in lower case.

This is a backport of https://review.openstack.org/263427

Co-Authored-By: Bjoern Teipel <bjoern.teipel@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: I4c8ac77c29ae4f3a1f6331fdaaab5d45abadcf44
Closes-Bug: #1530979
'}]
commit_message:
Store openstack_host_systat_enabled as lower case value for sysstat.default.j2

Sysstat won't enable unless the ENABLED switch has been set to true.
Passing openstack_host_systat_enabled as true inside jinja will end
up as a "True" value inside the /etc/default/sysstat rather then the
expected "true" value and sysstat won't start.

The added jinja filter lower will make sure that the boolean is always
stored in lower case.

This is a backport of https://review.openstack.org/263427

Co-Authored-By: Bjoern Teipel <bjoern.teipel@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: I4c8ac77c29ae4f3a1f6331fdaaab5d45abadcf44
Closes-Bug: #1530979

I don't find any role to mount the drives in swift object server nodes.
I think if the user knows the type of the file system that is
going to be used, we can mount the drives as well using
the playbook without manual intervention.

Change-Id: I6d590677bbe3ea763eecebad2128f0dbd80e7563
Closes-Bug: #1535536

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-09 00:14:47.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/trunk/models.py', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/EXPAND_HEAD', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/newton/expand/0e877ec3cba3_add_index_to_trunk_model_and_adjust_.py'], 'message': "Add index on trunk_id in the subports model

An index on trunk_id will make queries that return subports from a given
trunk_id efficient.  When I first approved the trunk and subports model,
I thought that having trunk_id in the primary key would be sufficient.
However, thinking about it some more, I realize that isn't the case
because trunk_id is listed as the second column in the primary key.

Think about it like searching a string index for something that matches
in the last half of a string.  The index doesn't make that efficient.
The DB must still search all entries for matches.  It is the same with
the index on (port_id, trunk_id) that the primary key provides.  You
need to look through every row to find matching trunk_ids.  Hence the
addition of an index.

Change-Id: I566863fd44aa402230d2eb83e99bc66e7fed8d80
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
"}]
commit_message:
Add index on trunk_id in the subports model

An index on trunk_id will make queries that return subports from a given
trunk_id efficient.  When I first approved the trunk and subports model,
I thought that having trunk_id in the primary key would be sufficient.
However, thinking about it some more, I realize that isn't the case
because trunk_id is listed as the second column in the primary key.

Think about it like searching a string index for something that matches
in the last half of a string.  The index doesn't make that efficient.
The DB must still search all entries for matches.  It is the same with
the index on (port_id, trunk_id) that the primary key provides.  You
need to look through every row to find matching trunk_ids.  Hence the
addition of an index.

Change-Id: I566863fd44aa402230d2eb83e99bc66e7fed8d80
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

by default. A new var: ``utility_ssh_private_key`` has been
introduced for deployers who desire this behavior.

subject: Revert "Gate: prepopulate cluster with one server"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-10 06:26:17.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ci/rally-gate.sh'], 'message': 'Revert "Gate: prepopulate cluster with one server"

This reverts commit 994ed06f64577fd1e719852047b72f95600561e5
(and its follow-up, b861c0cd4259deac7a0d371436006d78957ec47c)
because it broke gate-networking-midonet-v2-rally-dsvm-nv job.

In midonet, typically admin tenant has two networks,
the usual "public" and midonet-specific "uplink".
booting a VM without specifying a network fails with
"Multiple possible networks" error there.

The reasoning of the original commit is rather unclear to me,
as listing security groups is enough to populate the default
security groups for the tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1589876
Change-Id: Ia90a8f4a68f558205ddae87c0a3c2ff0bdc89945
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Gate: prepopulate cluster with one server"

This reverts commit 994ed06f64577fd1e719852047b72f95600561e5
(and its follow-up, b861c0cd4259deac7a0d371436006d78957ec47c)
because it broke gate-networking-midonet-v2-rally-dsvm-nv job.

In midonet, typically admin tenant has two networks,
the usual "public" and midonet-specific "uplink".
booting a VM without specifying a network fails with
"Multiple possible networks" error there.

The reasoning of the original commit is rather unclear to me,
as listing security groups is enough to populate the default
security groups for the tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1589876
Change-Id: Ia90a8f4a68f558205ddae87c0a3c2ff0bdc89945

A conditional has been added to the ``_local_ip`` settings used in
the ``neutron_local_ip`` which removes the hard requirement for an
overlay network to be set within a deployment. If no overlay network

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add conditional for overlay network settings

A conditional has been added to the ``_local_ip`` settings used in
the ``neutron_local_ip`` which removes the hard requirement for an
overlay network to be set within a deployment. If no overlay network
is set within the deployment the ``local_ip`` will be set to the
value of ``ansible_ssh_host``.

Change-Id: I954a46443b5434b589226c4999e71bd6ba6a5c0b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-08 21:53:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/api/admin/test_external_network_extension.py', 'neutron/tests/tempest/api/test_metering_extensions.py', 'neutron/tests/tempest/scenario/test_basic.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'neutron/tests/tempest/api/test_qos.py', 'neutron/tests/tempest/api/test_flavors_extensions.py', 'tools/misc-sanity-checks.sh', 'neutron/tests/tempest/api/test_extension_driver_port_security.py'], 'message': "Add sanity check for idempotent id's in tempest tests

Idempotent id's for tempest tests must be unique, as it's used to trace
tests even in the event of refactors [1].

This patch adds a new check using check-uuid tool from tempest to
validate id uniqueness. This adds a new test-only dependency to pull in
tempest from PyPI to make pep8 tox target work.

Also, the duplicate idempotent id's in our tests have been fixed.

[1]
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/HACKING.html#test-identification-with-idempotent-id

Change-Id: Ie92e4576d9ce6c26f19bdd668426c71a62409e7a
"}]
commit_message:
Add sanity check for idempotent id's in tempest tests

Idempotent id's for tempest tests must be unique, as it's used to trace
tests even in the event of refactors [1].

This patch adds a new check using check-uuid tool from tempest to
validate id uniqueness. This adds a new test-only dependency to pull in
tempest from PyPI to make pep8 tox target work.

Also, the duplicate idempotent id's in our tests have been fixed.

[1]
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/HACKING.html#test-identification-with-idempotent-id

Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie92e4576d9ce6c26f19bdd668426c71a62409e7a

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-18 04:32:04.000000000', 'files': ['templates/ceilometer.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/update-aodh-integration-fd2a27e8864bd8ff.yaml'], 'message': 'Update Aodh integration

The Aodh integration with Ceilometer no longer relies on Ceilometer
connecting directly to an alarm storage engine to answer API calls,
when Aodh is enabled. Instead it will redirect requests related to

Depends-On: I440b4c8127eff2dc517d7ff8e277c6d7a5f106ce

commit_message:
Update Aodh integration

The Aodh integration with Ceilometer no longer relies on Ceilometer
connecting directly to an alarm storage engine to answer API calls,
when Aodh is enabled. Instead it will redirect requests related to
alarms to Aodh.

Depends-On: I440b4c8127eff2dc517d7ff8e277c6d7a5f106ce
Change-Id: I4a3f6b69b6b19118248c383c1d58c99e1a7f8262

subject: Auto-enable Ceilometer + Aodh integration
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-17 16:45:36.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/ceilometer_all.yml'], 'message': 'Auto-enable Ceilometer + Aodh integration

Ceilometer can conditionally delegate and redirect all alarm related
activity to Aodh. This can now be auto-enabled through this variable
combined with the related change in the os_ceilometer role. A
deployers can force-disable this integration by overriding the var.

Related Change: I4a3f6b69b6b19118248c383c1d58c99e1a7f8262

Change-Id: I440b4c8127eff2dc517d7ff8e277c6d7a5f106ce
'}]
commit_message:
Auto-enable Ceilometer + Aodh integration

Ceilometer can conditionally delegate and redirect all alarm related
activity to Aodh. This can now be auto-enabled through this variable
combined with the related change in the os_ceilometer role. A
deployers can force-disable this integration by overriding the var.

Related Change: I4a3f6b69b6b19118248c383c1d58c99e1a7f8262

Change-Id: I440b4c8127eff2dc517d7ff8e277c6d7a5f106ce

Since os-brick has a function linuxscsi.get_name_from_path to translate
/dev/disk/by-path/ entry to /dev/sdX, so os.path.realpath should be replace
by linuxscsi.get_name_from_path.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I34a03d5a91160182ea0279d777bfa82b233ca601
'}]
commit_message:
os.path.realpath should be replace by linuxscsi.get_name_from_path

Since os-brick has a function linuxscsi.get_name_from_path to translate
/dev/disk/by-path/ entry to /dev/sdX, so os.path.realpath should be replace
by linuxscsi.get_name_from_path.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I34a03d5a91160182ea0279d777bfa82b233ca601

subject: Provide way to "initialise" oslo.privsep
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-16 05:20:45.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_privsep/daemon.py', 'oslo_privsep/tests/test_daemon.py', 'oslo_privsep/tests/test_priv_context.py', 'oslo_privsep/priv_context.py'], 'message': 'Provide way to "initialise" oslo.privsep

Specifically, the goal here is to provide a default that can use
rootwrap.

This change implements a `priv_context.init` function that allows
oslo.privsep to hook into the startup of programs using oslo.privsep.
The intention is to call this function near the top of main() - after
oslo.config is available but before anything "interesting" is performed.

In this change, this init function just allows you to set the default
"run as root" prefix for helper_command to include something like
rootwrap.

In the future, it is expected to use this same call point to do other
"early" tasks like immediately forking privileged helpers and dropping
root if already running as root.

Change-Id: I3ea73e16b07a870629e7d69e897f2524d7068ae8
Partial-Bug: #1592043
'}]
commit_message:
Provide way to "initialise" oslo.privsep

Specifically, the goal here is to provide a default that can use
rootwrap.

This change implements a `priv_context.init` function that allows
oslo.privsep to hook into the startup of programs using oslo.privsep.
The intention is to call this function near the top of main() - after
oslo.config is available but before anything "interesting" is performed.

In this change, this init function just allows you to set the default
"run as root" prefix for helper_command to include something like
rootwrap.

In the future, it is expected to use this same call point to do other
"early" tasks like immediately forking privileged helpers and dropping
root if already running as root.

Change-Id: I3ea73e16b07a870629e7d69e897f2524d7068ae8
Partial-Bug: #1592043

first if  we choose to start a new container
with name say XXX, however in the env a container
already exist with XXX name and second to start a stopped container.

Change-Id: Ibd6c5fbcc6f37ea2481634ac2e6b3edb91ae7aab
Partially-Implements: blueprint ansible-unit-tests

commit_message:
Connect to remote hosts as root

Since this is the user for which we setup the SSH key.

This commit allows to run kolla-ansible as vagrant user without using
sudo.

This only applies to multinode.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ie5231085a66511a520d4dbe5e9f35414acf1900b

commit_message:
Only keep localhost for 127.0.0.1

The regex used previously would keep the short hostname (hostname -s)
on the 127.0.0.1 line.

Reset the 127.0.0.1 line to keep only localhost.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I90bdec6793ac5b2d304e178e5114369b7b3b9626

commit_message:
Set internal vip to vagrant private network

In vagrant environments, the kolla_internal_vip_address didn't belong
to the private network provisioned on the machine and was failing the
prechecks.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0e7e4d134e350c49ef7510c7262677754a83bcbf

commit_message:
Remove 413 from image_metadata

There is not any places which raise an HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge
exception on Nova v2.1 API.
Then this patch removes 413 from image_metadata and code from
QuotaError because EC2 code has been removed already.

Change-Id: Ib79056cf65343c21146d77c3d2f829a59f138a7d

commit_message:
Make wos_used_bytes equals 0 when reports ''

When nothing has been written in vertica, wos_used_bytes
will stay empty and this is causing an issue  when vertica
plugin tried to convert empty string to an integer.

Change-Id: I604b58c0da1020efa531bf5a4338da144352b08f

subject: Refactor SG callbacks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-26 12:09:32.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/ml2/mech_driver.py', 'networking_odl/tests/unit/ml2/test_mechanism_odl_v2.py', 'networking_odl/common/callback.py', 'networking_odl/ml2/mech_driver_v2.py', 'networking_odl/tests/unit/common/test_callback.py'], 'message': "Refactor SG callbacks

The code was a bit messy so simplified it for the following reasons:
* AFTER is always used so no need to have this as parameter
* Although bulk operations are supported by ODL, Neutron notifications
  are sent on a per-resource basis
* Transformation between singular & plural should be done with the
  existing constants (and not simply by appending or removing 's')
* URL translation is only necessary in the V1 driver so moved it there
* Tests were repetitive so extracted common logic
* Generally tried to organize & simplify the code

Change-Id: I2542831d205eed3083a8e0da08e57b83a14e74aa
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor SG callbacks

The code was a bit messy so simplified it for the following reasons:
* AFTER is always used so no need to have this as parameter
* Although bulk operations are supported by ODL, Neutron notifications
  are sent on a per-resource basis
* Transformation between singular & plural should be done with the
  existing constants (and not simply by appending or removing 's')
* URL translation is only necessary in the V1 driver so moved it there
* Tests were repetitive so extracted common logic
* Generally tried to organize & simplify the code

Change-Id: I2542831d205eed3083a8e0da08e57b83a14e74aa

This patch set is to show/hide the lock/unlock actions using
the locked status from nova.

2.9 or above, which can be set on local_settings.py.

Closes-bug: #1505845

commit_message:
Show instance lock/unlock actions based on the locked status

The server locked information has been added to nova v2.9.

This patch set is to show/hide the lock/unlock actions using
the locked status from nova.

To get the locked status, the compute version needs to be
2.9 or above, which can be set on local_settings.py.

Change-Id: I947c544b32d6056beae97f1c2aa121dd38fb733b
Closes-bug: #1505845

commit_message:
Add a hook for test debug

There may be a case when a developer wants to run tests with
debugger specially, when they are broken. This patch will add a
hook in tox so that developers can set break points in their
test can debug them if needed.

commit_message:
Make identity v2 user_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes identity v2 user_client use **kwargs.

Also adding some doc link.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I058e74a205ff9223113ad9fed8be61e6b66e7045

In particular, we were expecting the domid to be an integer
when comparing against -1 in vmops.py to decide if the domain
was shut down.  This test always failed, so domid of -1 was
assumed to be a live domain.

Fix all places where domid is an integer to ensure only string
comparisons are done.
If the domid is '-1' then we raise an exception based on the
instance.  An instance is always passed, so make it clear that
this is non-optional

Closes-Bug: 1592849
"}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: Integers returned from XAPI are actually strings

In particular, we were expecting the domid to be an integer
when comparing against -1 in vmops.py to decide if the domain
was shut down.  This test always failed, so domid of -1 was
assumed to be a live domain.

Fix all places where domid is an integer to ensure only string
comparisons are done.
If the domid is '-1' then we raise an exception based on the
instance.  An instance is always passed, so make it clear that
this is non-optional

Change-Id: I8c0d3274fbf68351a1b077e791e50e449ea0af99
Closes-Bug: 1592849

commit_message:
Netmask needs corersion to string

Occasionally the netmask value is passed as an int and we need
to force coercion into a string before joining otherwise we get
a TypeError

Original review commit: c06e552fd5a16f3682bac4455f2f75c952cf4eba
Original review Title: Adds ACL, IP Pool, Multipath to Datera Driver

Change-Id: I677d300bc8e99d4f4d70562c6ef46330b575008c
