commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: I1e300c5f6ad9f443203504ea9f95e35b49fbde19

subject: Fix settings for CephFS data and metadata pools
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 18:23:09.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ceph'], 'message': "Fix settings for CephFS data and metadata pools

Although the devstack ceph plugin uses variables - CEPHFS_DATA_POOL and
CEPHFS_METADATA_POOL - as arguments to the 'osd pool create' commands
that provision the pools required for manila to use the CephFS Native
backend, the overrides to the default values for these variables sets
both of them to $CEPHFS_CEPH_POOL. This setting is counter-intuitive,
and worse, forces use of a single pool for both data and metadata in the
case both default values are overridden.

Use CEPHFS_DATA_POOL and CEPHFS_METADATA_POOL as the override
variables for the data pool and metadata pool, respectively.

Change-Id: Iae2859388ce5e74b6f532cf2cf7809aaa09746cb
Closes-Bug: 1593829
"}]
commit_message:
Fix settings for CephFS data and metadata pools

Although the devstack ceph plugin uses variables - CEPHFS_DATA_POOL and
CEPHFS_METADATA_POOL - as arguments to the 'osd pool create' commands
that provision the pools required for manila to use the CephFS Native
backend, the overrides to the default values for these variables sets
both of them to $CEPHFS_CEPH_POOL. This setting is counter-intuitive,
and worse, forces use of a single pool for both data and metadata in the
case both default values are overridden.

Use CEPHFS_DATA_POOL and CEPHFS_METADATA_POOL as the override
variables for the data pool and metadata pool, respectively.

Change-Id: Iae2859388ce5e74b6f532cf2cf7809aaa09746cb
Closes-Bug: 1593829

subject: Fix for multiple status_set() in assess_status()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 13:53:48.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_rabbit_utils.py', 'hooks/rabbit_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix for multiple status_set() in assess_status()

This fixes a multiple status_set() bug in the implementation of assess_status()
on the charm, when it is determining whether it is active AND clustered.
The change hooks into the _determine_os_workload_status() directly in
charmhelpers to ensure that status_set() is only called once when
assess_status() is called.

Change-Id: Idfd93126c3edb41f83897c82ee7f20fe5f366559
Related-Bug:#1588462
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for multiple status_set() in assess_status()

This fixes a multiple status_set() bug in the implementation of assess_status()
on the charm, when it is determining whether it is active AND clustered.
The change hooks into the _determine_os_workload_status() directly in
charmhelpers to ensure that status_set() is only called once when
assess_status() is called.

Change-Id: Idfd93126c3edb41f83897c82ee7f20fe5f366559
Related-Bug:#1588462

Change-Id: I2ee8ba0ab264a9c6208f616f2c3ec09d200be0bc

commit_message:
Add exception/signal handling to HTTP client

This adds HTTP status code checking and requestslib exception handling
to the SynHTTPClient. It also adds the notion of a "signal", which is a
kind of "check" in the HTTP client, such as catching an exception or a
500 HTTP status code.

Change-Id: I2ee8ba0ab264a9c6208f616f2c3ec09d200be0bc

subject: Do not prompt for scope options with default scoped tokens
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-17 16:37:23.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/api/auth.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1592062-e327a31a5ae66809.yaml', 'openstackclient/shell.py', 'openstackclient/tests/common/test_clientmanager.py', 'openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py'], 'message': 'Do not prompt for scope options with default scoped tokens

This changes the scope validation to occur after a token has already
been created.

Previous flow:

1. Validate authentication options.
2. Validate authorization options if the command requires a scope.
3. Create a token (using authentication + authorization options)
4. Run command.

This means that scope was being checked, even if a default scope was
applied in step 3 by Keystone.

New flow:

1. Validate authentication options.
2. Create token (using authentication + authorization options)
3  Validate authorization options if the command requires a scope and
   the token is not scoped.
4. Run command.

Change-Id: Idae368a11249f425b14b891fc68b4176e2b3e981
Closes-Bug: 1592062
'}]
commit_message:
Do not prompt for scope options with default scoped tokens

This changes the scope validation to occur after a token has already
been created.

Previous flow:

1. Validate authentication options.
2. Validate authorization options if the command requires a scope.
3. Create a token (using authentication + authorization options)
4. Run command.

This means that scope was being checked, even if a default scope was
applied in step 3 by Keystone.

New flow:

1. Validate authentication options.
2. Create token (using authentication + authorization options)
3  Validate authorization options if the command requires a scope and
   the token is not scoped.
4. Run command.

Change-Id: Idae368a11249f425b14b891fc68b4176e2b3e981
Closes-Bug: 1592062

commit_message:
lib/neutron-plugins: Pass conf file parameter

The 'neutron_plugin_configure_l3_agent' function expects a path to a
configuration file as a parameter. This was not done for one call,
resulting in the generation of a 'DEFAULT' file in the DevStack
directory along with an invalid L3 configuration file. Resolve this.

Change-Id: I5781cb1ec4cfc1699e61dbc324d0bdb824b56be1

subject: Increase rgw init timeout to 1200 seconds
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 14:45:40.000000000', 'files': ['templates/ceph.conf'], 'message': "Increase rgw init timeout to 1200 seconds

This changeset increases the initialization timeout
for rgw instances from 300 -> 1200 seconds.

This change decreases the chance that the rgw instance
will timeout prior to OSD's actually joing the Ceph storage
cluster as usable storage is required for this operation.

Change-Id: I6c5442edc2fb25ff37d7a4bd0bc49aabd6f2d24c
Closes-Bug: 1577519
(cherry picked from commit 3bacc91230dbc00305d0fac677b4022bda58e350)
"}]
commit_message:
Increase rgw init timeout to 1200 seconds

This changeset increases the initialization timeout
for rgw instances from 300 -> 1200 seconds.

This change decreases the chance that the rgw instance
will timeout prior to OSD's actually joing the Ceph storage
cluster as usable storage is required for this operation.

Change-Id: I6c5442edc2fb25ff37d7a4bd0bc49aabd6f2d24c
Closes-Bug: 1577519
(cherry picked from commit 3bacc91230dbc00305d0fac677b4022bda58e350)

commit_message:
Ceph Radosgw Race

This patch adds some deeper inspection to the ceph-mon
and ceph-radosgw relation.  It will now wait for 3 osds
to be both up and in the cluster before telling the radosgw
that it is allowed to connect.

Change-Id: Ibe5d397859859765a6e1b8694495f62be77111bd
Closes-Bug: 1577519

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-06-16 06:48:50.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/remove-overrides-17ef7d0496f6a6c7.yaml', 'playbooks/inventory/dynamic_inventory.py', 'tests/test_inventory.py'], 'message': 'Remove deleted override vars from inventory

When re-running the dynamic_inventory.py script, either directly or via
a playbook run, deployers expect that their edits to
openstack_user_config.yml are reflected in the inventory. However, previous
behavior only added new entries or updated existing variables with new
values; variables that were deleted remained in the inventory JSON
file.

This patch only corrects behavior for the variables includes in the
global_overrides dictionary. Similar behavior may be present in other
aspects of the inventory, such as removing host vars, but those should
be addressed in later patches.

Closes-Bug: #1588902

Change-Id: I86d6627ef34d99c7ef3c77fcd42c918a13f0fe81
'}]
commit_message:
Remove deleted override vars from inventory

When re-running the dynamic_inventory.py script, either directly or via
a playbook run, deployers expect that their edits to
openstack_user_config.yml are reflected in the inventory. However, previous
behavior only added new entries or updated existing variables with new
values; variables that were deleted remained in the inventory JSON
file.

This patch only corrects behavior for the variables includes in the
global_overrides dictionary. Similar behavior may be present in other
aspects of the inventory, such as removing host vars, but those should
be addressed in later patches.

Closes-Bug: #1588902

Change-Id: I86d6627ef34d99c7ef3c77fcd42c918a13f0fe81

commit_message:
Config options: centralize driver libvirt options (1)

The config options of the "nova.conf" section "libvirt" got
moved to the new central location "nova/conf/libvirt.py".
Subsequent patches will then another options in libvirt section.
This is the first patch in a long-chain patchs.

subject: Add transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-06-15 19:09:37.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'manifests/notify.pp', 'spec/classes/sahara_init_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/add_transport_url_parameters-973b95ec1ad18717.yaml', 'spec/classes/sahara_notify_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Add transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging

This commit adds the transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging. The
url is of the form:

  transport://user:pass@host1:port[,hostN:portN]/virtual_host

Where the transport scheme specifies the rpc or notification backend
as one of rabbit, amqp, zmq, etc. Oslo.messaging is deprecating the
host, port, and auth configuration options [1]. All drivers will get
these options via the transport_url.

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::default resource
* use oslo::messaging::notifications resource
* add parameters for transport_url(s)
* update spec tests
* add feature release note

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317285/

Change-Id: If5f30ba1944d897d2dd63539f4bb8a80e6c46c5e
'}]
commit_message:
Add transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging

This commit adds the transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging. The
url is of the form:

  transport://user:pass@host1:port[,hostN:portN]/virtual_host

Where the transport scheme specifies the rpc or notification backend
as one of rabbit, amqp, zmq, etc. Oslo.messaging is deprecating the
host, port, and auth configuration options [1]. All drivers will get
these options via the transport_url.

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::default resource
* use oslo::messaging::notifications resource
* add parameters for transport_url(s)
* update spec tests
* add feature release note

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317285/

Change-Id: If5f30ba1944d897d2dd63539f4bb8a80e6c46c5e

subject: Support users without projects in keystone library
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-11 19:33:39.000000000', 'files': ['library/keystone'], 'message': 'Support users without projects in keystone library

Update the ensure_user, ensure_user_role, and ensure_group_role commands
and dependent functions to allow creation of and role assignment to a
user without specifying a project.
This will allow use of the keystone library for creating users, such as
the heat stack admin, within only a domain.

Since a role can only get granted to either a project or domain at one
time, only attempt to grant the role within the project if both are
provided.

Notifications of state changes for the ensure role commands have also
been fixed.

Partial-Bug: 1579612
Change-Id: I6a132e5407c9881a047037b85bd6e25b85c0d8a1
'}]
commit_message:
Support users without projects in keystone library

Update the ensure_user, ensure_user_role, and ensure_group_role commands
and dependent functions to allow creation of and role assignment to a
user without specifying a project.
This will allow use of the keystone library for creating users, such as
the heat stack admin, within only a domain.

Since a role can only get granted to either a project or domain at one
time, only attempt to grant the role within the project if both are
provided.

Notifications of state changes for the ensure role commands have also
been fixed.

Partial-Bug: 1579612
Change-Id: I6a132e5407c9881a047037b85bd6e25b85c0d8a1

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: Ia4cbe14575851c0f54cbb5845ffd6b8669fb7fa2

revisions:

The 'linters' job currently does not deploy the upper-constraints
file, so it cannot be used by any of the lint jobs it activates.

This patch switches the builder to ensure that upper-constraints

Change-Id: Iada3a91ee0885710c0fee5aead689b5cdcea118e

commit_message:
Enable linters job to use upper-constraints

The 'linters' job currently does not deploy the upper-constraints
file, so it cannot be used by any of the lint jobs it activates.

This patch switches the builder to ensure that upper-constraints
can be used.

Change-Id: Iada3a91ee0885710c0fee5aead689b5cdcea118e

commit_message:
Add temporary workaround for build failure

Currently builds are failing due to a dependency-of-dependency update
in gulp-header (via gulp-angular-templatecache) that is looking for
a file that doesn't exist. This adds an empty file to satisfy it as a
workaround.

Change-Id: I6849892d8f6d4a397f6fc29975041c6da9fef0f8

subject: Consider pre-existing VMs when testing server list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-15 20:42:07.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_list_servers_negative.py'], 'message': 'Consider pre-existing VMs when testing server list

When running the test_list_servers_by_limits_greater_than_actual_count
test using pre-provisioned accounts, the test gives a false positive
since it does not consider the VMs the user could already have before
the test started.
This commit fixes the test by considering those pre-existing VMs a
user might have.

Change-Id: I5d18cdced9f074d3214f9f0b9515929ba5bf7c04
Closes-Bug: 1592971
'}]
commit_message:
Consider pre-existing VMs when testing server list

When running the test_list_servers_by_limits_greater_than_actual_count
test using pre-provisioned accounts, the test gives a false positive
since it does not consider the VMs the user could already have before
the test started.
This commit fixes the test by considering those pre-existing VMs a
user might have.

Change-Id: I5d18cdced9f074d3214f9f0b9515929ba5bf7c04
Closes-Bug: 1592971

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-16 23:11:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/extensions/test_dns_integration.py', 'neutron/services/externaldns/drivers/designate/driver.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-designate-driver-ssl-options-169c299c96f2aff0.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix designate dns driver for SSL based endpoints

Allow setting options in designate section to specify if want
to skip SSL cert check. This makes it possible to work with HTTPS
based endpoints, the default behavior of keystoneclient is to always
set verify=True however in current code, one cannot either provide
a valid CA cert or skip the verification.

DocImpact: Introduce two additional options for `[designate]` section
in neutron.conf
CONF.designate.insecure to allow insecure connections over SSL.
CONF.designate.ca_cert for a valid cert when connecting over SSL

Change-Id: Ic371cc11d783618c38ee40a18206b0c2a197bb3e
Closes-Bug: #1588067
'}]
commit_message:
Fix designate dns driver for SSL based endpoints

Allow setting options in designate section to specify if want
to skip SSL cert check. This makes it possible to work with HTTPS
based endpoints, the default behavior of keystoneclient is to always
set verify=True however in current code, one cannot either provide
a valid CA cert or skip the verification.

DocImpact: Introduce two additional options for `[designate]` section
in neutron.conf
CONF.designate.insecure to allow insecure connections over SSL.
CONF.designate.ca_cert for a valid cert when connecting over SSL

Change-Id: Ic371cc11d783618c38ee40a18206b0c2a197bb3e
Closes-Bug: #1588067

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-17 03:16:23.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'message': "Change port used for Ironic static http to 3928

Due to recent infrastructure changes, infra began using port 8088. This
caused a conflict with our apache config, causing services to not start.
Infra is changing this port (Ie67bbba02dbf61a481f66001de3e0dede9448316)
but it may take up to a week to take effect.

Instead of having our gate broken for a week, I'm changing the default
port. 3928 was not chosen at random; it's listed as the netboot-pxe
service port in /etc/services.

Change-Id: Ifdcf3c82fd9ee64c1548e47dba4c78c2347959e0
Co-Authored-By: John L. Villalovos <john.l.villalovos@intel.com>
Closes-bug: 1590139
(cherry picked from commit 2898b622f7072995b0c778d2a762adba5afe75aa)
"}]
commit_message:
Change port used for Ironic static http to 3928

Due to recent infrastructure changes, infra began using port 8088. This
caused a conflict with our apache config, causing services to not start.
Infra is changing this port (Ie67bbba02dbf61a481f66001de3e0dede9448316)
but it may take up to a week to take effect.

Instead of having our gate broken for a week, I'm changing the default
port. 3928 was not chosen at random; it's listed as the netboot-pxe
service port in /etc/services.

Change-Id: Ifdcf3c82fd9ee64c1548e47dba4c78c2347959e0
Co-Authored-By: John L. Villalovos <john.l.villalovos@intel.com>
Closes-bug: 1590139
(cherry picked from commit 2898b622f7072995b0c778d2a762adba5afe75aa)

commit_message:
Refactor test_shell

This file has become difficult to maintain with conditionals
everywhere to handle the different http clients.

This change replaces the http mocking code with calls to a handful of
mock methods, and deletes what is left unused.

Change-Id: Id2339b63a90f4805afe94f89f4c2715834588c61

subject: Install pkg-config package
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-16 21:50:15.000000000', 'files': ['vars/debian.yml'], 'message': "Install pkg-config package

pkg-config is required to build a wheel for libvirt-python. In the
trusty gate tests it's a dependency of another installed package, in
xenial it's only suggested.

Add pkg-config to repo_build_apt_packages to ensure that it's installed.

Change-Id: Ib86cbd38287fdad539ef6451cd5662422b9abf7b
"}]
commit_message:
Install pkg-config package

pkg-config is required to build a wheel for libvirt-python. In the
trusty gate tests it's a dependency of another installed package, in
xenial it's only suggested.

Add pkg-config to repo_build_apt_packages to ensure that it's installed.

Change-Id: Ib86cbd38287fdad539ef6451cd5662422b9abf7b

commit_message:
Remove extra gather_facts setting from playbooks

The lxc-containers playbooks had gather_facts specified twice, and
ansible was always using the latter defintion.

This removes the duplicate entry so that deployer variable settings are
honored.

Change-Id: I9d921c252acc4bc0790a42cbefe725d579c0cbeb

commit_message:
Refer to operator VM as primary VM

This allows us to execute vagrant commands by default on the 'operator'
VM and eliminate one of the difference between AIO and multinode.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ia14aa026d1146ec4b1e006c72a2460edfc0cf6eb

subject: Add IPv6 rule creation to validation resources
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-06-16 22:55:12.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/validation_resources.py'], 'message': 'Add IPv6 rule creation to validation resources

This commit adds a stage for creating ipv6 security group rules if
ip_version_for_ssh is set to 6. Previously, we would only create the
ipv4 rules even if we knew that ipv6 was going to be used for ssh.

Co-Authored-By: Chris Lee <chris.lee@dreamhost.com>
Change-Id: I1a27babf772481f4651c55d9cd2e3c9efa12da32
Closes-Bug: #1593416
'}]
commit_message:
Add IPv6 rule creation to validation resources

This commit adds a stage for creating ipv6 security group rules if
ip_version_for_ssh is set to 6. Previously, we would only create the
ipv4 rules even if we knew that ipv6 was going to be used for ssh.

Co-Authored-By: Chris Lee <chris.lee@dreamhost.com>
Change-Id: I1a27babf772481f4651c55d9cd2e3c9efa12da32
Closes-Bug: #1593416

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

Change-Id: I90519337e83447c1824e26bbd3b3c29115feef75
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: I90519337e83447c1824e26bbd3b3c29115feef75

commit_message:
Add copy-ansible to console-log publisher

This is our first attempt to enable zuul-launcher to publish our
ansible playbooks to static.o.o. I've confirmed JJB will not covert
this in to jenkins XML.

Change-Id: I271d551cfa2043127022cc80fe405b2c623981aa
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 00:37:55.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'message': "Change port used for Ironic static http to 3928

Due to recent infrastructure changes, infra began using port 8088. This
caused a conflict with our apache config, causing services to not start.
Infra is changing this port (Ie67bbba02dbf61a481f66001de3e0dede9448316)
but it may take up to a week to take effect.

Instead of having our gate broken for a week, I'm changing the default
port. 3928 was not chosen at random; it's listed as the netboot-pxe
service port in /etc/services.

Change-Id: Ifdcf3c82fd9ee64c1548e47dba4c78c2347959e0
Closes-bug: 1590139
"}]
commit_message:
Change port used for Ironic static http to 3928

Due to recent infrastructure changes, infra began using port 8088. This
caused a conflict with our apache config, causing services to not start.
Infra is changing this port (Ie67bbba02dbf61a481f66001de3e0dede9448316)
but it may take up to a week to take effect.

Instead of having our gate broken for a week, I'm changing the default
port. 3928 was not chosen at random; it's listed as the netboot-pxe
service port in /etc/services.

Change-Id: Ifdcf3c82fd9ee64c1548e47dba4c78c2347959e0
Closes-bug: 1590139

commit_message:
Move pep8 requirements in their own target

There's no need to depends on all the stack, as hacking is pulling
everything. We also can only install hacking in the pep8 target, as it's
not used per say for tests in tooz.

Change-Id: I69426ab2373ba2f76b098cf9e9eb812c8124748f

commit_message:
Add migration to make service type unique

Previously, mutliple services could be of the same type.
But, service name shouldn't be required since service type is already
a required attribute of service and should be unique.
So, this patch makes service type unique.

Change-Id: I772e13a2310496b8fc426bd26a07f3e58e8cd2d5
Closes-Bug: #1259425

Here we fully remove node-devstack from nodepool.  I've changed
refrences to it to be cache-devstack as that is the only function the
now defunct node-devstack element was providing.  I did not do this to

commit_message:
Remove node-devstack from nodepool

Here we fully remove node-devstack from nodepool.  I've changed
refrences to it to be cache-devstack as that is the only function the
now defunct node-devstack element was providing.  I did not do this to
openstack-repos as it has already moved to the prepare-node element.

Change-Id: I1dacd9e1af5ebb6056998f6f2705317eddc87714
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

commit_message:
Auto generate Bay/BayModel name

Add a feature to Magnum to auto-generate human readable names,
like Docker does for un-named containers. Use this feature if
no name is specified upon the creation of a Bay/Baymodel.

Change-Id: I290fb4ad0692c63e6e40af3ec705f205c5ec66d3
Partially-Implements: blueprint auto-generate-name

commit_message:
Drop neutron/i18n.py in favor of neutron/_i18n.py

The hacking rule already ensures everyone uses neutron._i18n.
Now we can drop neutron.i18n.

Closes-Bug: #1520094

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: Ia3b04c0ea4576ef50e3bc88de366738ba645a0ff

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: Ib0c1da50750027f343bd3b77dcd6b85a059435dd

commit_message:
remove ability to create barbicanclient

keymanager is implemeted using castellan library.
moreover, barbicanclient client was removed from requirements
of sahara at [0], so it's safe to remove that from our code

also removing session for admin method since it's no longer
needed.

[0] I8cb08a365c6175744970b1037501792fe1ddb0c7
Closes-bug: 1593668

Change-Id: I434c0dbc8810a06fb4b9686ffe556c3724f9efff

commit_message:
Fix tempest jobs failing because of extra arguement

Change [1] added extra parameter
that is passed to gate hooks. As [2] that fixes this failure
introduces refactoring that is not relevant for stable/liberty
branch, it is easier just to make a straightforward fix rather than
backport it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/322811/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320998/

Change-Id: Iacf414151de1df5fd890dc5dbb157eff93b5af3f
Closes-Bug: #1592564

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 11:33:24.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

'}]
commit_message:
Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Our requirements
should match OpenStack requirements anyway.

This patch pins to the current master requirements from the
OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

Change-Id: Ic62fa455cc32b13765f8fadf0fa260773741f0d3

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: Ie9b1f1a3a52dacdf258863d505e9f3b00b093eec

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: Ibbbd4148e2fc8c8a8b2126f9ca7be5c36187d75f

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: Iad8888761d1016b833585bd33ca3758e8ade769f

commit_message:
Replace tempest_lib with tempest.lib

As the tempest_lib is deprecated and the code has been moved into
tempest. We should use tempest.lib instead of tempest_lib.

Related-Bug: #1589713

Change-Id: I141455236fccfc5deed4b39151a8581cbaa76f0e

Deleted volume_type_projects while deleting volume_types to
cleanup all the associated volume_type_projects records.

This commit uses project_id from cinder/tests/unit/fake_constants.py
so I have also updated the existing hard coded project_id to use it

Closes-Bug: 1589809
Change-Id: I457215e328e7315cb95df7f928beb92910b58255
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup volume_type_projects

Currently we are not able to delete volume_type_projects after
deleting volume_types and it persists in the database forever.
Deleted volume_type_projects while deleting volume_types to
cleanup all the associated volume_type_projects records.

This commit uses project_id from cinder/tests/unit/fake_constants.py
so I have also updated the existing hard coded project_id to use it
from fake_constants to maintain the consistency in the module.

Closes-Bug: 1589809
Change-Id: I457215e328e7315cb95df7f928beb92910b58255

commit_message:
Update manage_existing to use volume object

The following patch updates manage_existing APIs to use volume versioned
objects. Changes were made to be backward compatible with older RPC
clients. Changes in the drivers are left to each driver maintainer to
update.

Note that this patch DOES NOT try to use object dot notation everywhere
to keep the size small. This cleanup will be done in the future.

Change-Id: Ie806336ad95834b091c5942d7dfa13345006c1c8
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

commit_message:
Change flavor show command

Command usage as follow:
usage: nova flavor-show <flavor>
Show details about the given flavor.
Positional arguments:
  <flavor>  Name or ID of flavor

Change-Id: I52bc33445258eed9a2d90f9e4d3916dfb55efbaa

subject: Fix bug with detailed error on job binary creation
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-14 09:41:02.000000000', 'files': ['sahara_dashboard/content/data_processing/jobs/job_binaries/forms.py'], 'message': 'Fix bug with detailed error on job binary creation

When a job binary with an invalid name is created (for example
too long) Sahara returns an well-defined exception, but Horizon
just says:
Error: Unable to create job binary
I fix this bug.

Change-Id: I2b7ef115454d8965fcd8971a20102681eb1245b0
Partial-bug: 1427277
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug with detailed error on job binary creation

When a job binary with an invalid name is created (for example
too long) Sahara returns an well-defined exception, but Horizon
just says:
Error: Unable to create job binary
I fix this bug.

Change-Id: I2b7ef115454d8965fcd8971a20102681eb1245b0
Partial-bug: 1427277

commit_message:
Fix exception propagation

Make exception propagation from subprocesses and
threads work correctly.
Make exceptions propagate to top level program.
Make exceptions in subprocesses and threads log correctly.
Fix Tempest README.rst

Change-Id: If9ebe36afdc02c2460a86da7b4d9fa15e12c5824
Closes-Bug: #1592589

commit_message:
QoS DSCP fullstack tests

This patch introduces fullstack testing for the QoS/DSCP
Open vSwitch implementation. It depends on the python-neutronclient
patches, therefore it could not be merged in the main patch.

Co-Authored-By: Miguel Angel Ajo <majopela@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0ab6a1a0d1430c5791fea1d5b54106c6cc93b937
Closes-Bug: #1468353
Depends-On: I25ad60c1b9a66e568276a772b8c496987d9f8299

commit_message:
Temporarily remove duplicate block_device_allocate_* nova parameters

Upstream puppet-nova patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/290496/
affects Fuel, so we need to delete duplicate parameters to unlock
upstream change.

Change-Id: Ia6a24808784df859bc975bff70570ae8103e7eb7
Related-Bug: #1555572

subject: Switch consistent-return rule to warning mode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 12:20:32.000000000', 'files': ['.eslintrc'], 'message': 'Switch consistent-return rule to warning mode

eslint-config-openstack has this rule enabled, but in fuel-ui
it was disabled due to large number of violations. We need to
have as little overrides as possible. Also, this rule would help
us with new behaviour of jQuery v3 promises.

Change-Id: Iaeca17feb88bbd6ca51cd1e4727609a6298e5acf
'}]
commit_message:
Switch consistent-return rule to warning mode

eslint-config-openstack has this rule enabled, but in fuel-ui
it was disabled due to large number of violations. We need to
have as little overrides as possible. Also, this rule would help
us with new behaviour of jQuery v3 promises.

Change-Id: Iaeca17feb88bbd6ca51cd1e4727609a6298e5acf

This will be used in command classes descended from Display so

values.

Change-Id: I194e5b1af5996b103b0283ff34a48c4454540af6
'}]
commit_message:
Add a machine_readable attribute to base.Formatter class

This will be used in command classes descended from Display so
commands can decide to re-format Python data strictures in returned
values.

Change-Id: I194e5b1af5996b103b0283ff34a48c4454540af6

commit_message:
Migrating to layered charm

This is the built version simply because we do not have the
CI infrastructure up to handle layered charms yet, once we do
we can migrate this to the actual layers, currently hosted under
[github/chrismacnaughton](https://github.com/search?q=user%3AChrisMacNaughton+juju)

Change-Id: Iddc085415306a8127408c7c8f435ad1e84f0bd4c

revisions:

This option basically mimics the defaults, so rather than updating it
everytime the default in Neutron changes[1], and having to update

If someone wants a different setting, they should place it in their

commit_message:
Neutron: remove Q_ML2_PLUGIN_TYPE_DRIVERS

This option basically mimics the defaults, so rather than updating it
everytime the default in Neutron changes[1], and having to update
DevStack[2], let's just rely on the default.

If someone wants a different setting, they should place it in their
local.conf or have a DevStack plugin that configures what they need.

[1]: I8c29a1c1a7c79e02c26ac9e2ad2645d30dfbeefc
[2]: Id75651dfe57a07045a6932a0369668f33c7eef09
Change-Id: I7c10dfbc04cb11cb7792860bae13cd050d189f58

subject: Revert "Remove PyMI"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 12:42:35.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Revert "Remove PyMI"

This reverts commit 207d038866f3755a22d1862f32aa2e739e96d1fd.

The removal was done on the base that this is "not used by
any projects managed by requirements."

PyMI is used by os-win, see also
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330180/ for details.

os-win is part of requirements, see requirements/projects.txt

commit_message:
Revert "Remove PyMI"

This reverts commit 207d038866f3755a22d1862f32aa2e739e96d1fd.

The removal was done on the base that this is "not used by
any projects managed by requirements."

PyMI is used by os-win, see also
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330180/ for details.

os-win is part of requirements, see requirements/projects.txt

Change-Id: I188e4b927afb35756b3e0ee596792e674a3baf35

commit_message:
Increase rgw init timeout to 1200 seconds

This changeset increases the initialization timeout
for rgw instances from 300 -> 1200 seconds.

This change decreases the chance that the rgw instance
will timeout prior to OSD's actually joing the Ceph storage
cluster as usable storage is required for this operation.

Change-Id: I6c5442edc2fb25ff37d7a4bd0bc49aabd6f2d24c
Closes-Bug: 1577519

commit_message:
Fix grenade exclusion for ironic

This adds to the grenade regex that excludes it from running on
stable versions of ironic, where it doesn't work, to include the -nv
suffix if it exists.

It also removes the "voting: False" bit because it shouldn't even bother
running.

Change-Id: I5e33e5f687b849b738275aeac3dc7e607ad44a4e

VNFFG Extension used to support the Service Function Chaining.  Includes

commit_message:
Initial commit adds VNFFG Extension capable of creating SFC and Classifiers

VNFFG Extension used to support the Service Function Chaining.  Includes
resources to create chains and classifiers to classify traffic on to the
chains per tacker-sfc spec.  Also includes updates to validators to
accomodate some of the required Classifier match criteria.  Not all
match criteria is contained in this patch and will be added later.

Changes Include:
 - VNFFG Extension
 - VNFFG Plugin/DB (includes SFC and Classifier)
 - VNFFG Noop Driver

Change-Id: I8da751369f35e44a34f7037eaadd1974c1c22a1b
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

subject: Repair fuelweb_admin network metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 11:17:03.000000000', 'files': ['octane/tests/test_archivators_restore.py', 'octane/handlers/backup_restore/postgres.py'], 'message': "Repair fuelweb_admin network metadata

When upgrade from version 6.0 to 8.0, the fuelweb_admin network metadata
is restored from version 6.0. However, since version 6.1, certain params
in the metadata changed, which is reflected in fixture/admin_network.json
file.

Set 'gateway' field for network group 'fuelweb_admin' to the address
of the Fuel Master node.

Set 'vip_type' field in ip_addrs table for the 'fuelweb_admin' to NULL.

Change-Id: Ice94dcb7826b5357b9aaab56ea1632d77160db5e
Partial-bug: 1573075
"}]
commit_message:
Repair fuelweb_admin network metadata

When upgrade from version 6.0 to 8.0, the fuelweb_admin network metadata
is restored from version 6.0. However, since version 6.1, certain params
in the metadata changed, which is reflected in fixture/admin_network.json
file.

Set 'gateway' field for network group 'fuelweb_admin' to the address
of the Fuel Master node.

Set 'vip_type' field in ip_addrs table for the 'fuelweb_admin' to NULL.

Change-Id: Ice94dcb7826b5357b9aaab56ea1632d77160db5e
Partial-bug: 1573075

commit_message:
Escape angularjs templating in unsafe HTML

This code extends the unsafe (typically user-supplied) HTML escape
built into Django to also escape angularjs templating markers. Safe
HTML will be unaffected.

Closes-bug: 1567673
Change-Id: I0cbebfd0f814bdf1bf8c06833abf33cc2d4748e7
(cherry picked from commit 4bc01cedf39cdeff2553d01cdace707a1ecf6620)

commit_message:
Create releases only if they are absent

To support the backup/restore feature of a master node within one
release already presented release should not be loaded twice. This
change makes the ReleaseArchivator handler idempotent.

Change-Id: Id5b3130fe7e4e836cac1661639052db25a48050f

revisions:

Fixtures should be properly extended from the 'extend' attribute for all
embedded objects to support at least two nested levels. That is needed
to cover two Ubuntu releases dependent on one another in 9.0 or some
custom fixtures with a variable number of releases and their
dependencies.

Closes-Bug: #1592741
Change-Id: Ib74cc0656e0f7fec3e1b3de3ac4cc4fd83e45d99
"}]
commit_message:
Properly extend fixtures from openstack.yaml

Fixtures should be properly extended from the 'extend' attribute for all
embedded objects to support at least two nested levels. That is needed
to cover two Ubuntu releases dependent on one another in 9.0 or some
custom fixtures with a variable number of releases and their
dependencies.

Closes-Bug: #1592741
Change-Id: Ib74cc0656e0f7fec3e1b3de3ac4cc4fd83e45d99

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 01:08:26.000000000', 'files': ['octane/tests/test_archivators_restore.py', 'octane/handlers/backup_restore/postgres.py'], 'message': 'Remove code that sets the deployed_before flag

The deployed_before flag is not more required attribute of cluster
since the 9.0 release [1]. This patch removes the respective function
that is responsible for setting the flag for all cluster as a part of

[1] https://review.openstack.org/292804

commit_message:
Remove code that sets the deployed_before flag

The deployed_before flag is not more required attribute of cluster
since the 9.0 release [1]. This patch removes the respective function
that is responsible for setting the flag for all cluster as a part of
the database restore procedure.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/292804

commit_message:
Remove containers specifics from DB archivators

Since nailgun and keystone services are not isolated in containers their
processes should be stopped before to manipulate with databases and
data.

DB archivators are collected in DatabasesArchivator to apply the
'postgresql' task before to restore DB states. This task is needed to
configure databases, users and privileges according new parameters in
astute.yaml.

Some new functions were introduced to perform respective operations on
the host level, such as:
  - archivate.archivate_cmd_output
  - sql.run_psql

Change-Id: I67145808e8c453e371fe20575c5cc6a729db139a

commit_message:
Remove containers specifics from CobblerArchivator

Some manipulations with services were removed from this archivator
because puppet tasks will be re-used to re-initialize the master node.

PathFilterArchivator was added to support the simillar functionality
that ContainerArchivator provides but perform all operations in the
host filesystem.

Change-Id: I46c7f9980f1cb8696a340e663101bec1711f4247

commit_message:
Remove docker related code from AstuteArchivator

Since the removing docker containers from the host re-initialization of
services should be done by applying puppet manifests. The code that
responsible for doing this with containers were removed from
AstuteArchivator and now this archivator responsible only for restoring
the astute.yaml file, this re-initialization will be added as a separate
archivator.

Change-Id: Ied3b5132e9dce1c37b259f74d76c93f56dbcdf67

commit_message:
Bump version of keystoneauth1 to 2.7

Keystonemiddleware requires access to features released in keystoneauth
2.7. The latest version of keystoneauth is 2.8 however these are mostly
testing and OIDC changes that aren't required in the general case.

Change-Id: I81a754379819d0afcf51cb3c02dff15e36b07ece

commit_message:
Add function to run puppet tasks on a master node

Since the 9.0 release on a master node all services were moved from
docker containrs into the system namespace. All of these services are
initialized by puppet manifests that are organized in tasks for each
component, such as cobbler, nailgun, keystone, etc. The added function
provides an ability to apply one task by its name.

Change-Id: I301f8cacae87d5a64d3e99a2b351c00663b6db0a

commit_message:
Disable unsupported archivators

Docker containers where removed in the 9.0 release on the mater node
that is why unsupported archivators were disabled in this changes to be
able re-write them one-by-one.

A list of archivators that use containers and should be modified:
 -  astute.AstuteArchivator
 -  cobbler.CobblerArchivator
 -  puppet.PuppetArchivator
 -  postgres.KeystoneArchivator
 -  postgres.NailgunArchivator
 -  release.ReleaseArchivator
 -  logs.LogsArchivator
 -  puppet.PuppetApplyHost

Change-Id: I62f56070855ad4d8165c167bca6df0a97ad798c9

commit_message:
Add support for glance-api-ready relation flag

It's useful for service related to glance to know when it thinks
that its ready to start accepting requests, so that images can
be uploaded into Glance by other services in the cloud.

Add a 'glance-api-ready' flag to the image-service relation and
set status based on required interfaces being complete.

Change-Id: I28eba6f5fbc009b3c1e07a1180a85ddd17939404
Partial-Bug: 1528390

commit_message:
Fix flake8 issues

I have improved the readability of the code by fixing the
problems that flake8 reported.

The type of errors that are fixed are:
    * H302 - Import only module
    * H305 - Import not grouped correctly
    * H307 - Like imports shoud be grouped together
    * H402 - One line docstring needs punctation
    * F821 - Undefined name

Change-Id: I3a7f12120b6a99342a3d2025206edcdc0f6a4a93
Signed-off-by: Costin Galan <cgalan@cloudbasesolutions.com>

commit_message:
Use 'trimmed' for blocktrans in html page

blocktrans trimmed option removes newlines from contents of blocktrans
and replaces any whitespace at the beginning and end of a line into
a single space. This makes translator life easier.
More detail is described in the bug report.

Change-Id: Ic63629a1afe5606a58797ed69bf847447cad9c02
Closes-Bug: #1585428

subject: Fix Nailgun unavailability dialog
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 12:05:16.000000000', 'files': ['static/app.js'], 'message': "Fix Nailgun unavailability dialog

It was broken after upgrading jQuery to v3. It happend due to
backwards-incompatible changes in deferreds handling:

The resolution state of a Deferred created by .then() is now
controlled by its callbacks - exceptions become rejection
values and non-thenable returns become fulfillment values.
Previously, returns from rejection handlers became rejection
values.

Now it's required to explicitly return rejected promise from
rejection handler in app bootstrap promise chain.

Closes-Bug: #1592788

Change-Id: I2f1512fb421109bb9bc5063b7a314f5d53e16b1d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Nailgun unavailability dialog

It was broken after upgrading jQuery to v3. It happend due to
backwards-incompatible changes in deferreds handling:

The resolution state of a Deferred created by .then() is now
controlled by its callbacks - exceptions become rejection
values and non-thenable returns become fulfillment values.
Previously, returns from rejection handlers became rejection
values.

Now it's required to explicitly return rejected promise from
rejection handler in app bootstrap promise chain.

Closes-Bug: #1592788

Change-Id: I2f1512fb421109bb9bc5063b7a314f5d53e16b1d

commit_message:
Change to tempest stable API

Previously several places in murano tempest test use unstable tempest
api. In fact, it should use api from tempest.lib.* [1]. So fixed them
to make them more robust and resilient to tempest changes. The
unstable api removed here include:
  * tempest.clients
  * tempest.test

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/plugin.html#stable-tempest-apis-plugins-may-use

Change-Id: I018b00cc026a707da6afe40a327b44e97c16db53
Related-Bug: #1589713

- This change decomposes the install ironic role into 3 phases.
- The install phase will install all packages.
- The bootstrap phase generates all config files and configures the db.
- The start phase starts all biforst/ironic services.
- This change adds 3 new variable
  (skip_package_install, skip_bootstrap, skip_start) to optionally

- This change splits the inspector_install.yml to reflect the 3 phases.

Change-Id: Ifdfc935f594e29eb361ac31e8ae328744848258b
'}]
commit_message:
split ironic install role into install,bootstrap,start phases

- This change decomposes the install ironic role into 3 phases.
- The install phase will install all packages.
- The bootstrap phase generates all config files and configures the db.
- The start phase starts all biforst/ironic services.
- This change adds 3 new variable
  (skip_package_install, skip_bootstrap, skip_start) to optionally
  skip the install, bootstrap and start phases
- This change splits the inspector_install.yml to reflect the 3 phases.

Change-Id: Ifdfc935f594e29eb361ac31e8ae328744848258b

commit_message:
Rearrange lcm tests

Idempotency and ensurability tests have the general
base test which prepares environment.
So, their combination in the same groups
optimizes run of these tests

Change-Id: I8181eb4556aa68d41d15fb4c8df356b4fdc10992
Closes-bug: #1587958
(cherry picked from commit 6d49738a9bd5eaf1b7113f1adc953263521790d2)

Add pool listing to python designate client

Pool listing is required in downstream apps
which use python designate client like searchlight
to retrive list of pool.

subject: Ensure HTTP 204 responses have 0 Content-Length
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-15 18:51:11.000000000', 'files': ['designate/api/v2/controllers/zones/tasks/imports.py', 'designate/api/v2/controllers/zones/tasks/exports.py', 'designate/api/v2/controllers/zones/tasks/abandon.py'], 'message': "Ensure HTTP 204 responses have 0 Content-Length

These calls are misusing Pecan, and result in '' getting
serialized to JSON, which has a non-empty content-length
and that's against the rules of HTTP

closes-bug: 1592153

Change-Id: I1407d29c537273b07ab54c4e58c70d9bc4214759
(cherry picked from commit 3171dd5103aa7295b3947cafc35184ccfb9c9659)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure HTTP 204 responses have 0 Content-Length

These calls are misusing Pecan, and result in '' getting
serialized to JSON, which has a non-empty content-length
and that's against the rules of HTTP

closes-bug: 1592153

Change-Id: I1407d29c537273b07ab54c4e58c70d9bc4214759
(cherry picked from commit 3171dd5103aa7295b3947cafc35184ccfb9c9659)

commit_message:
Add support for building Centos 7 images for CDH 5.5

This commit adds support for diskimage-create.sh to create
Centos 7 images with CDH 5.5.
There are also minor changes to the repo definitions for
Centos/RHEL to use the $releasever variable
Also modifies the gate script to create the Centos 7 image

Change-Id: I9d563bdb5f5a1eb0243db376bf28113e8c416511
Closes-Bug: #1581233

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-06-14 01:51:12.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/utils.py', 'cinder/backup/api.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume_utils.py', 'cinder/volume/flows/api/create_volume.py', 'cinder/quota_utils.py', 'cinder/transfer/api.py', 'cinder/exception.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/flows/manager/manage_existing_snapshot.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_quota_utils.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': 'Handle quota exceed exception

This patch solves two problems:

1. Code duplication about handling quota exceed exceptions.

2. When extending a volume, if OverQuota is caught, Cinder
raised VolumeSizeExceedsAvailableQuota with data from
quota gigabytes. This is not correct, as it may exceed
gigabytes of volume type.

This patch is to transfer quota data from gigabytes or
[volume_type_name]gigabytes to VolumeSizeExceedsAvailableQuota.

3. Raise new exception if overs are not expected.

Change-Id: I811ce51a4aefe8a99f0f5197ab071212322c584d
Closes-bug: 1546890
'}]
commit_message:
Handle quota exceed exception

This patch solves two problems:

1. Code duplication about handling quota exceed exceptions.

2. When extending a volume, if OverQuota is caught, Cinder
raised VolumeSizeExceedsAvailableQuota with data from
quota gigabytes. This is not correct, as it may exceed
gigabytes of volume type.

This patch is to transfer quota data from gigabytes or
[volume_type_name]gigabytes to VolumeSizeExceedsAvailableQuota.

3. Raise new exception if overs are not expected.

Change-Id: I811ce51a4aefe8a99f0f5197ab071212322c584d
Closes-bug: 1546890

revisions:

KEYSTONE_PASSWORD, are no longer supported by the fuel client and were
changed on the actual ones, such as OS_USERNAME and OS_PASSWORD, in this
patch.

Change-Id: Id015b0426ca8ba93a947c68d9d8e1e207f1b91ad
'}]
commit_message:
Use OS_{USERNAME,PASSWORD} env variables for auth

The deprecated environments variables, such as KEYSTONE_USER and
KEYSTONE_PASSWORD, are no longer supported by the fuel client and were
changed on the actual ones, such as OS_USERNAME and OS_PASSWORD, in this
patch.

Change-Id: Id015b0426ca8ba93a947c68d9d8e1e207f1b91ad

commit_message:
Stable mitaka release for instack-undercloud

Cut a release for the instack-undercloud component.

The previous 4.0.0 release was tagged directly, so this adds the
deliverable and continues the numbering with a 4.1.0 release.

Note this has been validated via the following periodic CI:

http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ha-mitaka/d3b1c10/console.html

Change-Id: Iaa22fb4d7238f48392a5b8cec35946926f08c8c2

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-16 19:58:47.000000000', 'files': ['announce.sh'], 'message': "treat missing metadata as a warning not an error

Rather than exit with an error when the metadata is not present, report

Change-Id: If87b49fda044a54326a8bca600226ad838106027
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
treat missing metadata as a warning not an error

Rather than exit with an error when the metadata is not present, report
a warning and exit with a passing status code. That way the CI job won't
fail.

Change-Id: If87b49fda044a54326a8bca600226ad838106027
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 27, 'created': '2016-06-16 10:41:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Unplug vifs when VM create failed

Currently, when create VM failed(such as "_create_domain"
execute failed), do not unplug-ports correctly.

When rollback of VM create failed, we can not get the correct
network_info from "instance_info_caches". For example, If the
type of ports is sriov, the mac and vlan of vf will not be clear.

Change-Id: I08d3f7992990e1e4c5b5e9400416259d21ade6be
Closes-Bug: #1567843
'}]
commit_message:
Unplug vifs when VM create failed

Currently, when create VM failed(such as "_create_domain"
execute failed), do not unplug-ports correctly.

When rollback of VM create failed, we can not get the correct
network_info from "instance_info_caches". For example, If the
type of ports is sriov, the mac and vlan of vf will not be clear.

Change-Id: I08d3f7992990e1e4c5b5e9400416259d21ade6be
Closes-Bug: #1567843

subject: Use quickstart.sh to manage venv in all ci-scripts
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-06-17 03:41:50.000000000', 'files': ['ci-scripts/return-node.sh', 'ci-scripts/ci-base-requirements.txt', 'ci-scripts/collect-logs.sh', 'ci-scripts/get-node.sh'], 'message': 'Use quickstart.sh to manage venv in all ci-scripts

We currently have a step to activate the venv in the collect-logs,
get-node, and return-node scripts. The collect-logs script does
not need it at all anymore, and the {get,return}-node scripts can
instead pull in python-cicoclient via a requirements file.

Change-Id: I9754eae93942d9a89f77c0a2d8cc9839c537c39d
'}]
commit_message:
Use quickstart.sh to manage venv in all ci-scripts

We currently have a step to activate the venv in the collect-logs,
get-node, and return-node scripts. The collect-logs script does
not need it at all anymore, and the {get,return}-node scripts can
instead pull in python-cicoclient via a requirements file.

Change-Id: I9754eae93942d9a89f77c0a2d8cc9839c537c39d

commit_message:
Allow passing extra arguments to overcloud deploy script

The overcloud-deploy.sh script that's deployed into the undercloud is
very useful by itself. However, there are times where the installed
values are not enough to test something quickly. So this adds the
ability to pass extra arguments to the "openstack overcloud deploy"
that's within that script.

Change-Id: I4cad387da74a31c534cf809609eced646dd45f3a

subject: Use absolute paths for OPT_WORKDIR
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 07:36:55.000000000', 'files': ['quickstart.sh'], 'message': "Use absolute paths for OPT_WORKDIR

Ansible has a slight preference for absolute paths in some
cases/modules. For example, `with_file` requires an absolute path,
otherwise it'll append the relative path to the work dir where commands
are being run from.

Change-Id: I15713106cd8de2a3e0fb4478d032cedf79c41d61
"}]
commit_message:
Use absolute paths for OPT_WORKDIR

Ansible has a slight preference for absolute paths in some
cases/modules. For example, `with_file` requires an absolute path,
otherwise it'll append the relative path to the work dir where commands
are being run from.

Change-Id: I15713106cd8de2a3e0fb4478d032cedf79c41d61

commit_message:
report extra files with warnings

If the user forgets to add the .yaml extension, we ignore the
file. Instead of doing that silently, report that we see something and
that we're ignoring it.

Change-Id: I18130951a09a216339d3b63dc7decc67e766ee2d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

When cliff 2.1.0 was released, the constraint for "cliff-tablib" was
replaced with "cliff==2.1.0". This fixes the regex used in the sed
command to be a more exact match.

Change-Id: I435e42b25b13d12504b703e4c0ca64f385435ebe
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix the pattern matching in the constraint update logic

When cliff 2.1.0 was released, the constraint for "cliff-tablib" was
replaced with "cliff==2.1.0". This fixes the regex used in the sed
command to be a more exact match.

Change-Id: I435e42b25b13d12504b703e4c0ca64f385435ebe
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6899, 'name': 'Sirushti Murugesan', 'email': 'sirushtim@gmail.com', 'username': 'sirushtim'}, {'_account_id': 7239, 'name': 'Kiran Kumar Vaddi', 'email': 'kiran-kumar.vaddi@hp.com', 'username': 'kirankv'}, {'_account_id': 8289, 'name': 'huangtianhua', 'email': 'tiantian223@163.com', 'username': 'huangtianhua'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 10487, 'name': 'Kanagaraj Manickam', 'email': 'mkr1481@gmail.com', 'username': 'kanagarajm'}, {'_account_id': 12259, 'name': 'Anant Patil', 'email': 'anant.techie@gmail.com', 'username': 'ananta'}, {'_account_id': 12363, 'name': 'Oleksii Chuprykov', 'email': 'a.chuprikoff@gmail.com', 'username': 'ochuprykov'}, {'_account_id': 12404, 'name': 'Rico Lin', 'email': 'ricolin@ricolky.com', 'username': 'rico.lin'}, {'_account_id': 13009, 'name': 'Peter Razumovsky', 'email': 'prazumovsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'prazumovsky'}, {'_account_id': 20559, 'name': 'Dmitriy Uvarenkov', 'email': 'vitarcheg@gmail.com', 'username': 'duvarenkov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-17 07:04:44.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/openstack/monasca/test_notification.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/monasca/notification.py', 'releasenotes/notes/monasca-period-f150cdb134f1e036.yaml'], 'message': "Add period property to Monasca Notification resource

Currently, when one of Monasca's alarm transitions to the ALARM state, the
webhook associated with the Alarm is only invoked once. This is inconvenient
when the user wants to create a stack which will automatically scale up
or scale down more than once if the alarm state continues to be in the same
state.

The new added property 'PERIOD' will now allow the user to tell Monasca to
periodically invoke the webhook until the ALARM state transitions back to an OK
state.

To conform to the existing Heat autoscaling behaviour, we manually create the
monasca notification resource in Heat with a default value of 60 only for the
webhook notification type.

Change-Id: I2466911efa8d05dfe497f521885464ab90b0ae8e
"}]
commit_message:
Add period property to Monasca Notification resource

Currently, when one of Monasca's alarm transitions to the ALARM state, the
webhook associated with the Alarm is only invoked once. This is inconvenient
when the user wants to create a stack which will automatically scale up
or scale down more than once if the alarm state continues to be in the same
state.

The new added property 'PERIOD' will now allow the user to tell Monasca to
periodically invoke the webhook until the ALARM state transitions back to an OK
state.

To conform to the existing Heat autoscaling behaviour, we manually create the
monasca notification resource in Heat with a default value of 60 only for the
webhook notification type.

Change-Id: I2466911efa8d05dfe497f521885464ab90b0ae8e

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: I69687d6064c6a485fcb789220e5603054e775ddf

[{'number': 61, 'created': '2016-06-06 15:45:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/objects/resource_provider.py', 'nova/tests/functional/db/test_resource_provider.py'], 'message': "WIP Extend ResourceProvider to have resources and aggregates

There are pending discussion on how to make this work as
effectively as possible, so this is not a final design,
just a place to flesh out the ideas and explore where we've
had communication gaps.

A ResourceProvider now provides a facade over an Inventory, a
ResourceProviderAggregate and an Allocation. It is possible to
create a ResourceProvider, update its associated aggregates, and
inspect its associated inventories.

Associated aggregates are updated under the domain of the
object updating itself. Inventory is updated by independently
creating Inventory objects with the correctly associated resource
provider.

aggregates and resources are loaded lazily

ResourceProviderAggregates associated with it are destroyed too
but only if there are no allocations (if used == 0).

A ResourceProviderList now exists with a single classmethod to
get_all(), which will construct ResourceProvider objects for all
ResourceProviders that are not compute nodes. This satisfies the
needs of the resource pools api. The disjoint in name may need to
be resolved, if we care.

multiple tables the tests are hosted under the functional tree.

Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
Change-Id: I5b7dcee81bf37272a012fdfb0c5c8e8c2305045e
"}]
commit_message:
WIP Extend ResourceProvider to have resources and aggregates

There are pending discussion on how to make this work as
effectively as possible, so this is not a final design,
just a place to flesh out the ideas and explore where we've
had communication gaps.

A ResourceProvider now provides a facade over an Inventory, a
ResourceProviderAggregate and an Allocation. It is possible to
create a ResourceProvider, update its associated aggregates, and
inspect its associated inventories.

Associated aggregates are updated under the domain of the
object updating itself. Inventory is updated by independently
creating Inventory objects with the correctly associated resource
provider.

aggregates and resources are loaded lazily

When a ResourceProvider is destroyed the inventories and
ResourceProviderAggregates associated with it are destroyed too
but only if there are no allocations (if used == 0).

A ResourceProviderList now exists with a single classmethod to
get_all(), which will construct ResourceProvider objects for all
ResourceProviders that are not compute nodes. This satisfies the
needs of the resource pools api. The disjoint in name may need to
be resolved, if we care.

As most of the functionality involved here is driven by joins across
multiple tables the tests are hosted under the functional tree.

Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
Change-Id: I5b7dcee81bf37272a012fdfb0c5c8e8c2305045e

fixed_ips has a join relationship with port. During a DB transaction,
it will be acquired once. If the IPAllocation is updated after
acquiring fixed_ips, the port DB model object will still have the
stale value of fixed_ips, which is empty in the case of reported bug.

Expire the fixed_ips of the port can make the next query of port have
the latest fixed_ips, and thus, has the latest fixed_ips in the result
of update port.

Change-Id: I8ca52caf661daa2975cf53212d008eb953d83cc0
Closes-Bug: #1585738
'}]
commit_message:
Return fixed_ips from port update

fixed_ips has a join relationship with port. During a DB transaction,
it will be acquired once. If the IPAllocation is updated after
acquiring fixed_ips, the port DB model object will still have the
stale value of fixed_ips, which is empty in the case of reported bug.

Expire the fixed_ips of the port can make the next query of port have
the latest fixed_ips, and thus, has the latest fixed_ips in the result
of update port.

Change-Id: I8ca52caf661daa2975cf53212d008eb953d83cc0
Closes-Bug: #1585738

commit_message:
[Tempest] HotFix for broken CI jobs

Recently merged commit to "neutron-fwaas" project [1] started using
one of Tempest's modules that appeared after version our plugin uses.
So, implement hotfix-workaround until we make all compatibility changes
to latest Tempest in our plugin.

For the moment, we cannot switch to latest Tempest as we already
have incompatibility for it, see bug [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/326150/
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1586129

Change-Id: I44655c83cc5588c5b94d0fad81162dd0c238b5b4
Closes-Bug: #1589964

commit_message:
Add a build for the gerrit its-storyboard plugin

The its-storyboard plugin will allows us to integrate gerrit with
storyboard.  Add a build for the gerrit its-storyboard plugin[1].
Building this plugin also requires building the its-base plugin[2]
because the its-storyboard depends on its-base.  Refactored the build
job to build a parent project if it's defined in the project yaml.

[1] https://gerrit.googlesource.com/plugins/its-storyboard
[2] https://gerrit.googlesource.com/plugins/its-base

Change-Id: I7b8461bb47ba902158531a64ddf88a9bb2b03312

Sometimes apache fails to start after stop, due to unclosed

commit_message:
Use apachectl graceful to restart apache

Sometimes apache fails to start after stop, due to unclosed
resources. apachectl is recomended way to restart apache
service [0] to avoid such problems.
This patch replace stop/start by apachectl graceful in
restart_apache_server function.

Reference:
[0] https://wiki.apache.org/httpd/CouldNotBindToAddress

Change-Id: I4934ca8d28c03feb7d2015935cd279cf3304f0da
Closes-Bug: #1590139

commit_message:
Add raw results for Cobbler results.

 - Results for Cobbler installation when
   lpxelinux downloads kernel via http.
 - Results for Cobbler installation when
   lpxelinux downloads kernel via tftp.

subject: dispacher/gnocchi: measures sent fix logging
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-17 08:35:53.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/dispatcher/gnocchi.py'], 'message': 'dispacher/gnocchi: measures sent fix logging

Currently, the logging is only done when measures are posted on retry. If it
works on the first call, no logging is done. This can be confusing for users
that try to debug the Gnocchi dispatcher.

Change-Id: Ife7879fe0c153cec1a79c7d57529fda82b7b7c16
'}]
commit_message:
dispacher/gnocchi: measures sent fix logging

Currently, the logging is only done when measures are posted on retry. If it
works on the first call, no logging is done. This can be confusing for users
that try to debug the Gnocchi dispatcher.

Change-Id: Ife7879fe0c153cec1a79c7d57529fda82b7b7c16

subject: Copy images_client from tempest + Correct concurrency of gabbi 1.22.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-17 08:35:53.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/tempest/service/images/glance_http.py', 'ceilometer/tests/tempest/service/images/v2/images_client.py', 'ceilometer/tests/tempest/service/images/v1/images_client.py', 'ceilometer/tests/tempest/service/images/__init__.py', '.testr.conf', 'ceilometer/tests/tempest/service/images/v2/__init__.py', 'ceilometer/tests/tempest/exceptions.py', 'ceilometer/tests/tempest/service/client.py', 'ceilometer/tests/tempest/service/images/v1/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Copy images_client from tempest + Correct concurrency of gabbi 1.22.0

Now the gate test of ceilometer is broken, because the ceilometer test
is using nonstable tempest interfaces and these interfaces are changed.
QA team defines interfaces which are not under tempest.lib as unstable
clearly according to

https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/doc/source/library.rst#stability

So current test way is against the QA policy, so here is a workaround.
Copy&paste is not good, almost wrong. However, if still continuing the
tests, it would be a nice option to copy&paste and pass the gate test.
After QA team defines stable interfaces, that is a nice time to switch
using the stable interfaces with removing this copy&paste code.

Closes-Bug: #1589426

Depends-On: I3abd9049560ee507b3610ab482c697a239f13a3b
(cherry picked from commit 6c0b97b1e6fc03bdf84bf9b888761bd22ea0ad58)

+

When running gabbi under testr, concurrency grouping is controlled
by a regex in .testr.conf. A module name change in gabbi 1.22.0
inadvertently broke the grouping. This change should work for
old and new versions.

(cherry picked from commit 8fcbc8de4ea878bdec1ef8754eaf965e176854b3)

Change-Id: I30266f1b690ea105511d9b1162755bcc85e2e69a
'}]
commit_message:
Copy images_client from tempest + Correct concurrency of gabbi 1.22.0

Now the gate test of ceilometer is broken, because the ceilometer test
is using nonstable tempest interfaces and these interfaces are changed.
QA team defines interfaces which are not under tempest.lib as unstable
clearly according to

https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/doc/source/library.rst#stability

So current test way is against the QA policy, so here is a workaround.
Copy&paste is not good, almost wrong. However, if still continuing the
tests, it would be a nice option to copy&paste and pass the gate test.
After QA team defines stable interfaces, that is a nice time to switch
using the stable interfaces with removing this copy&paste code.

Closes-Bug: #1589426

Depends-On: I3abd9049560ee507b3610ab482c697a239f13a3b
(cherry picked from commit 6c0b97b1e6fc03bdf84bf9b888761bd22ea0ad58)

+

When running gabbi under testr, concurrency grouping is controlled
by a regex in .testr.conf. A module name change in gabbi 1.22.0
inadvertently broke the grouping. This change should work for
old and new versions.

(cherry picked from commit 8fcbc8de4ea878bdec1ef8754eaf965e176854b3)

Change-Id: I30266f1b690ea105511d9b1162755bcc85e2e69a
